Home Die2nite Residents Forum Suggestions Thread for Residents!
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Yay, I don't have to add "[D2N]" to the title! Anyways, this thread is for suggestions for Die2Nite. The basic format when entering a suggestion is:
Name Type (Ruin, Rare Blueprint, Food Item, etc)
Snazzy description.
What it does.
"In-game text if this object is used."
Here's the ideas that were posted before.
Gym Uncommon Blueprint
Work yourself and get in shape with top of the line exercise routines such as The Fat Cat Dumbbell Crunches, Guard Dog Cardio Routine, and Corpse Punching Bags Drill.
By using 2 AP, you become Fit.
"After all the straining, sweating, and panting, your ready to hit the showers."
Allows Heros to regain Healthy Body.
Unlocks 'Workout' option.

Requires: 10 Twisted Wooden Planks ; 4 Metal Supports ; 2 N&B

Fit Health Status
No pain, no gain. With your reflexes heightened, your ready to take on the world.
Increases your base AP to 7. (Meaning that instead of being to refilled to 6 when you eat or drink, you'll refill to 7)
+10% chance to kill a zombie with a weapon. (Charge counts)
+7% chance to not use 1 AP.
"(Normal action message) Instead of using the usual # AP, your training has allowed you to pace yourself properly, saving you 1 AP!"
+5% chance to kill a zombie with your bare hands.
Showering afterwards gives you an extra 1 AP. One time only.
"Ah, the refreshing feel of water over your strained body has refreshed your pores. You've gained 1 AP!"

Requires: Workout at Gym.

Mike's Gym Ruin
The birthplace of muscle junkies. Lucky me to find it.
You can find: Mobile Phone, Dumbbell, Punching Bag, Groundsheet, Antibiotic Steroids, Moldy Ham Sandwich, Mini HI-Fi (Broken), and Incomplete Cafeti√®re.

(Each Dumbbell and Punching Bag in the bank slightly increases Fit, Trained, and Healthy Body effectiveness.)

Kung-Fu Dojo Rare Blueprint
HI-YA! Prepare yourself, grasshopper, to become a warrior of war and mind.
Gains you the Trained status instead of Fit by using 2 AP.
Unlocks 'Train' option at the Gym.
All melee weapons increase it's effectiveness.
Decreases Gym use to 1 AP.
NOTE: You can still just use the Gym, but you must use the Gym first to use the Kung-Fu Dojo.

Requires: 10 Wooden Beams ; 2 Metal Supports ; 3 N&B ; 3 Rotting Logs ; Gym must be built.

Trained Health Status
You feel like a ninja from the movies. All your senses are heightened, your much more strategic, ready to defend yourself and your land.
Gains you 4 BP (Battle Points. Like Construction Points, but for fighting.)
Lasts until you use all your BP or the day ends.
Allows you the chance to kill up to 3 zombies.
"In a dazzling awe of jump kicks and chops, you managed to dominate # zombies!"
Gains you 1 bonus Control Point.
Pretty much a overhauled version of Fit.

Requires: Train at the Kung-Fu Dojo.

Charge Guardian Skill
FOR THE CROW! ARGGH!
Allows you to bypass a zone each day without using AP.
Allows for people to safely travel through the zone for the next 30 minutes.
Chance to kill 1-5 zombies.
"In your furious charge forward, # zombies crumbled beneath you! The rest are now disoriented."
Charge travels through the other side so watch out!

Charge (w/ Crumbling) Guardian Skill
FOR THE CROW! ARGGH!
Allows you to bypass a zone each day without using AP.
Allows for people to safely travel through the zone for the next 30 minutes.
Chance to kill 1-5 zombies.
"In your furious charge forward, # zombies crumbled beneath you! The rest are now disoriented."
Charging through buildings costs 2 AP with a 5% chance to get injured, 2% chance to die. Getting injured causes you to stay in the zone. The chance of death and injury increases depending to the number of zombies in the zone. Charging into a zone with a building doesn't have any effect, only if you Charge through it.
"You madly smash through the weakened walls of the old building successfully!"
"You madly smash through the weakened walls of the old building, but you slam into one of the tougher walls, causing you to severely injure your (bodypart)"
"You madly smash through the weakened walls of the old building, but you slam into one of the tougher walls, causing you to fall onto some twisted metal. You die from blood loss."
Charging through a building may cause it to collapse cause it to become buried.
Charging through a building gives the area a medium scavenging bonus since you would of opened more of the building up. It gives a 'Crumbling' effect to the building.
Charge travels through the other side so watch out!

Crumbling Effect
The building sure has had it's hard times. It's pretty much impossible to camp here now, but there's plenty of loot the damage has uncovered.
Created after uncovering a building, Charging through a building, or randomly.
Gives a scavenging bonus.
Severely decreases chance of surviving when camping.
Requires 2 AP to 'Repair the structure'. It also gives the ability to find a really rare item.
"After nailing in some loose planks and scooting heavy objects around, this place isn't looking to bad."
"After nailing in some loose planks and scooting heavy objects around, this place isn't looking to bad. While moving debris, you managed to find a (Blueprint, N&B, Twinoid 500mg, etc. The farther the building is, the better the loot.)"

Harvester Weapon/Furniture/Heavy Item
With some simple adjustments, this loud vacuum cleaner can scavenge even the most depleted zones. Yours now for only $199.99!
Finds better items, even in depleted zone.
Cuts auto-search time by 25%.
Killing a zombie results in getting a special (non-heavy) item. (N&B, Hacksaw, etc)
"Unsure of how to correctly use this as a weapon, you madly swing it around and drop it on a large rock. Oops."
"Unsure of how to correctly use this as a weapon, you madly swing it around and bash a zombie in the head, starting the vacuum. Amazingly, the vacuum finds a/an (Item)! Unfortunately, the vacuum has run out of juice..."
70% chance to break when attacking.
Battery depletes after an attack or the day ends.

Requires: Battery ; Incomplete Harvester.

Vacuum Furniture/Heavy Item
In small print on the side, it reads: 'Consuela's q....ity va..uums... 1986.' Maybe if you had some lemon Pledge you could clean some of the dirt off.
Combine with an Electronic Component, Duct Tape, Twisted Plank, and Man-bag to create Incomplete Harvester
Found at Citizen's Home, Citizen's Tent, Derelict Villa, Duke's Villa, Home Depot, PI-KEYA Furniture, and Small House.
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Vermin Pit Rare Blueprint
Easy recipe to your food problems. Just toss some garbage and rodents into a pit and enjoy. Watch out though, some of the fellas are a little frisky...
For 1 AP, you can 'Grab a pest'.
You can 'Release the lion' for no AP nor failure if you have a Fat Cat. (Useable once per day for 1-3 rats)
20% chance of failure.
5% chance to get infected.
"With cat like reflexes, you nab a Giant Rat!"
"With sloth like reflexes, you couldn't manage to get a [b]Giant Rat[b]..."
"The Fat Cat rains destruction upon the tiny rat folk. It happily trots back with # Giant Rats hanging from it's mouth."
"With sloth like reflexes, you reach for a Giant Rat. YEOW! That little devil just bit you. You are now Infected and the worst part is he got away..."

Requires: 15 Twisted Plank ; Meaty Bone (Perhaps required each day?) ; 2 Giant Rats ; Butcher must be built.

Boy Scout Distinction/Title
After getting 5 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Little Explorer' title.
After getting 25 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Boy Scout' title.
After getting 50 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Amateur' title.
After getting 75 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Badge Boy' title.
After getting 100 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Trooper' title.
After getting 125 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Mighty Man' title.
After getting 150 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Golden Sash' title.
After getting 175 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Camp Counselor' title.
After getting 200 'special' distinctions, you earn the 'Bear Grills Jr.' title.

Sacrifice Skill
If you're going out, go out like a Spartan.
Bonus "Armageddon Witness" perk?
Allows you to sacrifice yourself for extra 10 .
Adds a "Sacrifice" button in your house page. Will be used if you have clicked the button (thus having it 'activated') at the time of the attack. It doesn't work if you deselect the action or the defenses are high enough to deal with the attack.
Distinction:
Suicidal - The number of times you gave your life to help the town.
Titles:
Bait - Attain 5 "Suicidal" distinctions.
Come at me Bro - Attain 10 "Suicidal" distinctions.
Dedicated - Attain 20 "Suicidal" distinctions.
Zombie Hugger - Attain 50 "Suicidal" distinctions.
True Spartan - Attain 70 "Suicidal" distinctions.
Way Too Helpful... - Attain 100 "Suicidal" distinctions.

Tinkering Technician Skill
A little bit of twisting and banging and you can turn useless into useful.
For 2 AP (unaffected by factory or hacksaw), twice per day, you can transform Scrap Metal into an useful item.
65% success chance.
If successful, you can make: Handful of Nuts and Bolts, Sheet Metal (parts), PUTA Mark II Calibrator, Wire Mesh, or Screwdriver.
If failed, you can make: Scrap Metal, Unrecognizable Remains, or Shiny Sculpture.

Shiny Sculpture Decorative Item
It's not very shiny nor aesthetically pleasing, but it's fits well with the current decor.
Found from failed tinkering.
Adds 2 Decoration points.
Every time you make one you get the 'Trophy Of My Failures' distinction.

Storm Dance Shaman Skill
Ughah Boogie Woogie Woo. Come sky gods, I dance for you!
Once per day the shaman can try to summon a storm. If successful, some of the zones will be replenished.
30% chance to summon a storm.
10% chance to add 5-50 rations to the well
5% chance to clear zombies from the replenished zones.
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Somewhat-Lucky Charms Food Item
Blech. You almost feel good about eating that dog food last Tuesday. I mean, who's idea was it to put in these brown "X" things? They taste terrible, but the marshmallows are worth it.
Restores 6 AP.
When eaten, it gives you a slight chance of luck throughout the day from scavenging to sucessful crafts at the Workshop.

Ye Olde Keg Alcohol Item
Aye, you and yer lads and laddies are gonna have a good time chugging back the Ye Olde Keg.
Works like the Water Cooler Bottle, but for alcohol only.

Bundle of Fireworks Weapon Item
Sigh. No Whistling Bungholes, no Spleen Spliters,
Whisker Biscuits, Honkey Lighters, Hoosker Doos, Hoosker Don'ts, Cherry Bombs, Nipsy Daisers, with or without the scooter stick, or one single Whistling Kitty Chaser.
Kills between 1-5 zombies.
Zone is in control for 30 minutes.
4% chance of injury.
"Whoo hoo! That's the American spirit! Nothing more American than blowing sh*t up! In the blaze of the explosions, # zombies got hit upside the head with a firework. The rest are now disoriented. Remember to be safe this Fourth of July.
"Whoo hoo! That's the American spirit! Nothing more American than blowing sh*t up! One of the fireworks spun out of control and injured your (body-part)! Remember to be safe this Fourth of July."
Lava Jet Rare Blueprint
Some survivors just want to watch the horde burn.
+30 base defense.
Add 'fuel to the fire' for temporary defense:
Use a Patchwork Beam or Metal Support for +3 .
Use a Twisted Plank, Broken Electronic Device, Mechanism, or Wrought Iron for +2.
Use a Scrap Metal, Rotting Log, Crushed Battery, or Unrecognizable Remains for +1.
Requires: 10 Wrought Iron, 4 Metal Support, 2 Copper Pipe, and 1 Box of Matches ; Foundations must be built
Meditate Shaman skill
You light your skull themed candles lay down on your blood-red carpet and relax. The last few days of life threatening chaos suddenly seem calmer and the heavy burden of those who died around you is lifted. Then you realize you're laying in the piss that had when you were drunk last night.
Oh, well...
Every 2 days, the Shaman can Meditate, removing the terrorized effect.
Random chance to gain 1 AP.
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Since this is a general suggestion thread for D2N, I suggest that MT adds in some cheap mini-games. Not only for the extra entertainment and possible bonuses you can get for winning them*, but for keeping people active in case of emergency.
I'm pretty sure most of you guys get bored and exit out for the day while the more dedicated players might keep it open in a second tab while they go off to do other stuff and end up forgetting about it's there. It's not a very exciting game once you use all your AP for the day.
If MT introduces some nifty mini-games (even from the realistic standpoint the survivors have to entertain themselves somehow), more players will most likely hang around for a few extra minutes, possibly saving someone's life. I'm not saying make every action a mini-game, but perhaps add a few buttons in the 'Home' page that let's you play a few mini-games if you're bored and make it once per day if they give you boosts.
*Not really needed, but it'd be cool if you could autosearch slightly quicker by doing some scavenging mini-game and such.
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Scratch Card Miscellaneous Item
Make sure you borrow a coin from a friend. That way if you don't win, you can always steal the quarter.
You can win between 1 and 3 AP.
Randomly found anywhere.

Road Flare Miscellaneous Item
Instructions are to bang it on a rock and pray that someone notices it.
Can be found at Blocked Road, Ambulance, Disused Car Park, The 'Mayor-Mobile', Motorway Services, Wrecked Cars, Wrecked Transporter, or in the Shrewd Citizen's Stash (Resourcefulness).
Function: Increases the CP of a zone by 1 temporarily, is destroyed after the attack, and costs 1 AP to install.
One flare per square.

Decapitated Head Decorative Item
If it's beheaded, how can it be de-feet-ed?
Can only be created two ways; a kill w/ a bladed weapon (Machete, Chainsaw, Mower, Penknife, etc); or through the construction of the Guillotine a Bokor.
The head has a 20% chance of being found in the zone where the weapon kills were made or in a 3 km range around town if Guillotine was built
Function: Deco item that adds 4 deco points, an ingredient for Exorcisms, or object to regain control of a zone for 2 minutes (destroyed on use).
"You toss the Decapitated Head at the zombies and prepare to run as they bend over and munch on the face of their fallen comrade. By the way they're eating it, you've only got two minutes before they eat you next!"

Exorcism Shaman Skill
Is a Shaman specific ability that allows them to extract Weak Souls from Decapitated Heads, can only be used once per day
Has a 40% chance of success, resulting in the creation of a new Weak Soul
Has a 60% chance of failure, resulting in the destruction of the Head and you become Terrorized.
"As you tried to extract the soul, it's life flashed before your eyes. You saw it's first steps, first love, and the unspeakable horrors of it's final mortal moments. After seeing these events you curl into a ball, absolutely Terrorized as a blue mist surrounds the Decapitated Head and both disappear forever."**

Savior Distinction and Title
Awarded to those who clear more than 3 zombies in a zone with player in it allowing them to move freely.
Titles:
Zone Controller - Attain 5 'savior distinctions.
Lassie - Attain 10 'Savior' distinctions.
Guardian Angel - Attain 20 'Savior' distinctions.
Lifeguard - Attain 30 'Savior' distinctions.
No Survivor Left Behind - Attain 75 'Savior' distinctions.
Shepperd of the Idiots - Attain 100 'Savior' distinctions.

Sleep on the Roof Action
Being on the roof during disasters (like zombies flooding your town) is a good idea, but unfortunately it doesn't protect you very well from the elements.
Requires Hovel.
+5 home defense.
If the entire town does it, they will gain a bonus of 20-50 'lazy' zombies.
60% chance of Dirt in your Eyes and/or Shivers, 30% chance of injury, and 10% chance of death.

Dirt in you Eyes Health Status
It's not surprising you have Dirt in your Eyes. You do live in a desert.
Works like injuring your eye, but only lasts for a day and doesn't get infected.
60% to get it while Sleeping on the Roof.
30% chance to get it while camping in a normal zone unless you have a Groundsheet or Sunglass.
15% chance to get it while walking for over 12 unless you have Sunglasses.
"Your eyes become irritated and feel puffy. Looks like you got Dirt in your Eyes from being outside in the elements."

Shivers Health Status
You can't seem to stop shaking uncontrollably. Luckily, it should go away by tomorrow.
Zombie kill probability decreases by 20%.
Weapon reliability decreases by 10%.
Actions requiring has a 5% chance of failure (construction included, but it's separate for each used. For instance you use 6 towards the pump, but two of them fail from having Shivers so only 4 are put in).
60% to get it from Sleeping on the Roof and/or being Terrorized.
30% chance to get it from camping in a normal zone unless you have a Groundsheet.

Sunglasses Decoration Item
Look cool and be protected from the sun's harmful rays.
Uses an inventory space.
+1 Decoration point if put into your chest.
Protects you from Dirt in your Eyes (unless you're Sleeping on the Roof).
Found at normal zones, Abandoned Hotel, Abandoned Park, Blocked Road, Citizen's Home, Derelict Village, Dilapidated Building, Disused Car Park, Guns 'n' Zombies Armoury, The 'Mayor-Mobile', Motel 666 Dusk, Old Police Station, Scottish Smith's Superstore, Shady Bar, Small House, Wrecked Cars, Wrecked Transporter.
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

New Items: Dead men¬¥s tools
Once assembled these 7 itens have the ability to give a Profession to a citizen until he dies on that town. They are the Professional Tools of long-dead heroes in the World Beyond. They are extremely hard to find (same chance as Hacksaw/Guard Dog? or worse). They are always found in the incomplete form. Each tool give the abilities of the corresponding Professions but dont give the heroic actions/features that heroes have nor count as hero days. Here they are:

Loose Labradoodle
This dog have scars all over its body. You dont know how it can stand still since it also have lost another leg (yes, he have two now). He looks starving and sad. It follows you but dont obey your commands.
Can be "fixed" with a Broken human bone + Tasty-looking Steak;
Once fixed it becomes a professional tool called 2 Leg-Labradoodle and cant be droped
It give the ability to return the owner rucksack to town bank or personal chest. It also help its owner to find the ruins exit, in the same way as a Tamer can.

Broken S. Spade
This was a spade used by a long-dead hero. Not every rotting log can be used to fix it¬¥s handle. You must find a proper stick with the exact size.
Can be fixed with a Broken Staff (30% chance, the Broken Staff vanish if fails.)
Once fixed it becomes a profissional tool called Small Spade and cant be droped.
It give the ability to fast scavenge, just like a Scavenger have. This spade dont give the oxygen bonus in ruins though.

Half of V. Mask
Once a powerfull object, this dusty half voodoo mask appear to be useless. Once in a while you can see a faint glow in the eye hole... Must be a mirage.
Can be fixed with another Half of V. Mask
Once fixed it becomes a Professional Tool called Voodoo Mask and cant be droped
It allows the user to carry how many souls their rucksack can carry. The user can also convert Weak souls and sense where they are, just like a Shaman. The user can also use the Make it Rain and Heal abilities aswell.

Torned C. Suit
This piece of rag in camouflage pattern can help you to sneak between zombies. You just need to find some more rags and pray to have better luck than its previous owner
Can be fixed with 2x Groundsheet;
Once fixed it becomes a Professional Tool called Camouflage Suit and cant be droped;
It allow the user to be as sneakiness as a Scout. It dont provide estimation of neighbour zone¬¥s zeds though.

Rusty R. Shield
This Riot Shield is all covered in rust. It is somewhat twisted and have lots of sharp barbs on its surface. You dont want to hold it properly at least until you can find a way to clean this "tetanusful" thingy first.
Can be fixed with 2x Corrosive Acid
Once fixed it becomes a Professional Tool called Riot Shield and cant be droped
It provides +2 CP to the zone and contributes with town defence, just like a Guardian do.

Incomplete S. Guide
You found what seems to be one of those teach-yourself books with the survivalist theme. Too bad that it have several pages missing or illegible because of dry blood.
Can be fixed by an Instruction Manual*
Once fixed it becomes a Professional tool called Survival Guide and cant be droped
It can provide all benefits of a "genuine" Survivalist to whoever has it. (camp bonus + ability to find water or food once a day).

*OBS: To fix this item your town must have at least one Survivalist (alive) so whoever have this item can copy its instructions from their neighbour¬¥s book in the back pages of the Instruction Manual.

PPE Helmet
This helmet belonged to the town¬¥s tech savvy who died in the World Beyond a long time ago. Its useless now, but as soon as you wore that you felt a urge to build and repair things (and twiddle your thumb in the process too).
Can be assembled by a Belt, a Toolbag and an Adjustable Spanner.
Once fixed it becomes a Professional tool called Handyman's Toolbelt and cant be droped.
It provides all benefits that Techinicians have (Construction Points + keys stuff).

Heroes that are playing other professions can do a combo by adding a second (or third) Profession this way. This means that a Scavenger, for example, can be also a Tamer if he finds and fix a Loose Labradoodle. This also happens if a lucky Resident finds and fix 2 or more of these items.

These items are not heavy in the incomplete form. However, they occupy 1 rucksack space EVEN when fixed (meaning that its risky to be 3 or more of them at same time). They can be stored in bank normaly (on the Miscellaneous category).

You cant assemble a second Profession Tool that is the same as an active one that you have.

Finding one of these tools grant a Luck distinction. You will also receive the distinctions for playing the Profession accordingly to the survived days.

Heres some sketch images http://i.imgur.com/dI4Zu.pngStale Doughnut Food Item
It's a bit stale and tastes more like a bagel, but it's still a pretty tasty doughnut.
Restores 6 once eaten.
Found at normal zones, Dilapidated Building, Fairground Stall, Looted Supermarket, Mini-Market, Old Police Station, Scottish Smith's Superstore, and Strange Circular Device.
Found in Doggy Bags.

Schoolhouse Rare Blueprint
Heros often lecture Residents daily on important survival tips inside this crudely made schoolhouse. Perhaps you can go learn how to find water or how to sneak past a zombie.
Allows a Resident to gain the perk of having the basic hero abilities for a day (Can't use Heroic Return, Seeker, or Escort people (still can find water if they choose the Survivalist)).
Doesn't count as a hero day.
Residents use 3 to "Study (hero class)".
Residence can only choose one class to study per day.
"After a long hour of learning, you are ready to show off the skills you learned out. You've gained the basic abilities of a (hero class)!"
Heros must check in daily, like the watchtower.
Originally takes 15 heros to unlock perks.
Daily Upgrade:
Level 1 - Decreases heros needed to unlock perk to 10.
Level 2 - Reduces needed to "Study (hero class)" to 2.
Level 3 - Decreases heros needed to unlock perk to 5.
Level 4 - Reduces needed to "Study (hero class)" to 1.
Level 5 - Allows Residence to use Hero Actions and escort.
Requires: 100 , 10 Twisted Plank, 5 Patchwork Beam, 2 Metal Supports, 1 Handful of Nuts and Bolts, and 1 J√§rpen Table. Foundations must be built.

Mortar Shell Weapon Item
The rusty piece of metal obviously came from some kind of artillery gun. Hopefully it hasn't become a dud after spending all this time in the sand...
Kills between 1-4 zombies.
Becomes Scrap Metal when used.
"You arm the bomb and toss it at the undead's head and cower down to protect yourself from the blast. After the dust clears, you see the scattered bits of # zombies! All that's left of the Mortar Shell itself is shrapnel."
Found at normal zones, Army Outpost, Broken-down Tank, Equipped Trench, Guns 'n' Zombies Armory, Nuclear Bunker
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Large Straw Hat Miscellaneous item
This oddly large hat does a good job of protecting you from the sun. It also makes you look like Huckleberry Finn.
Allows you to walk two extra zones without becoming Thirsty, Dehydrated, or die from dehydration.
Found at normal zones, Abandoned Hotel, Abandoned Park, Citizen's Home, Citizen's Tent, Dark Woods, Derelict Villa, Garden Shed, Once-inhabited Cave

Glass Bottle of Cola Food Item
A bottle of soda is a luxury in these dark times, even though this one is pretty hot...
Cures Thirsty.
Restores 7 (water doesn't restore your afterwards)
"The fizzy taste gives you an extra 1 !"
Found at normal zones, Burnt School, Citizen's Home, Citizen's Tent, Derelict Villa, Duke's Villa, Fairground Stall, Fast Food Restaurant, Fraser D's Kebab-ish, Looted Supermarket, Mac's Atomic Cafe, Mini-Market, Scottish Smith's Superstore, Small House.

Overrun Landing Pad Ruin
This place is covered in worthless debris, but there's several large military-looking crates scattered around the helipad. The overturned helicopter also looks military, but it's clear to see it's beyond repair.
Here you can find a(n) Electronic Component, Handful of Nuts and Bolts, Devastator (incomplete), Sheet Metal (parts), Food Parcel, Machine Gun (empty), Revolver (empty), Engine (incomplete), Radius Mark II Beacon (incomplete), Full Jerrycan, PUTA Mark II Calibrator, EMS System (incomplete), Iron Chest.

Mangled Corpse Miscellaneous/Heavy Item
The leftover remains of some poor lad who ended up as zombie dinner. Yet another example that zombies have poor table manners.
You can "Dissect Mangled Corpse" to get a(n) Fleshrooms, Meaty Bone, Pound of Flesh, Bloody Dressing, Intestine Melon, Festering Flesh.
"You look away and quickly begin pulling off limbs and flesh from the Mangled Corpse. A few seconds later, you manage to salvage a(n) [item] from the mess you made. One man's corpse is another man's treasure.
Can be taken to the Cremato-Cue for 4 Human Flesh.
Putting it into your chest will give you -1 Decoration point (wont affect soul-points or already earned decoration points) and the following message with appear:
"Why the heck are you putting a rotting body in your house? That's disgusting."
30% chance to appear where someone died in The World Beyond.
Found at Ambulance, Burnt School, Citizen's Home, Citizen's Tent, Derelict Villa, Duke's Villa, Equipped Trench, Indian Burial Ground, Old Field Hospital, Small House.

They should add in an option to go into "Careful" and "Extra Careful" modes.
Careful mode will make you have you make sure you want to do an action in your home. Example:
Are you sure you want to Build: Matches? ; Are you sure you want to upgrade to Hovel?*
Extra Careful mode does even more. Example:
Are you sure you want to move to the East? ; Are you sure you want to use 6 on Watchtower?
Things like ingesting cyanide will always ask you to make sure whether you have either of these modes turned off.

* Can't remember if it already asks you that.

Torn Blanket Furniture Item
It reminds you of your childhood blanket. Ten years after you threw it away..
Adds +1 Decoration to your home.
Used in level three Siesta Time‚Ñ¢(Mattress is moved up into a level four Siesta Time‚Ñ¢)
Combine with a Torch to get an Upgraded Torch. The Upgraded Torch lasts three days and kills two zombies before becoming a Burnt out Torch.
Cures Terrorized status if left in chest overnight.
Found at normal zones, Abandoned Hotel, Citizen's Home, Citizen's Tent, Derelict Villa, Duke's Villa, Motel 666 Dusk, Small House.
Gas Can Miscellaneous Item
Usually used to refill your vehicle with gas or to douse a body and evidence.
Combine it with Homemade Flamethrower (empty) to create Homemade Flamethrower (ready)
Found at normal zones, Blocked Road, Disused Car Park, Old Aerodrome, Wrecked Cars, Wrecked Transporter.
Homemade Flamethrower (ready) Weapon Item
Time to made some extra crispy zombie flamb√©!
Combine a Box of Matches or Torch and a Jerrycan Pump to create a Homemade Flamethrower (empty)
Uses Gas Cans as ammo.
Kills 2 to 10 zombies.
20% chance to run out per attack.
Deserted Gas Station Ruin
The perimeter is covered in worn signs saying, "No Gas!", "Looters have to face the shooters!", and "Low supplies!". Both the convenience store and garage looks pretty barren, but perhaps there's something left over.
Here you can find a Gas Can, Handful of Nuts and Bolts, Screwdriver, Chest, Can, Packet of Soft Crisps, Beer Fridge, Car Door (incomplete), Engine (incomplete), Incomplete Cafeti√®re, Sheet Metal (parts), Tool Bag, Instruction Manuel, Opened Packet of Cigarettes, Repair Kit.
Molotov Cocktail Armory Item
Obviously the creator of the Molotov Cocktail was drunk when he came up with this one.
Combine a Torn Blanket, Gas Can, and 'Wake the Dead' to create a Molotov Cocktail.
Must have a Box of Matches or Torch in your inventory to use this item.
Kills 5 to 12 zombies and distracts the rest for one minute.
Destroyed on use.LQP-79 ImunoShot Drug
A dose with the atenuated letal Lysergic Quinine Protein, said to be the resposible for the zombie ressucitation. This vaccine never worked properly, but it might help to fight the agent and postpone death by infections.
Every time its used it diminish by 10% the chance of death by Infection. (but no lower than 30%)
Can be obtained by mixing Pharmas
Cannot be found in searches, only in certain buildings

Deserted Prison Complex Explorable Ruin
There was no getting in or out of here, especially for the prisoners who were trapped inside and had died from dehydration. You can walk down the cell blocks see their rotting bodies in some of the tiny windowless rooms.
Here you can find a Taser (incomplete), Pathetic Penknife, Rusty Chain, Box of Games, Shrewd citizen's stash, Guard Dog, Dried Chewing Gum, Meaty Bone, Wire Mesh, Unlabeled Drug, Stagnant Water Can, Giant Rat, A letter with no address.
Destroyed Safe House Ruin
The house looks like it was home to a small band of survivors until the zombies broke through. Many of the windows are broken and there's a lot of blood on the floor and walls from some sort of final stand. Hopefully you wont encounter the same fate they did...
Here you can find a Duct Tape, Handful of nuts and bolts, Water Pistol (empty), Manbag, Box of Games, Chest, Large Chest, Trestle, Half-Eaten Chicken Wings, Human Flesh, Can, Doggy Bag, Beer Fridge, Boxes, Makeshift Barricade, Revolver (empty), Full Jerrycan, Radio Cassette Player (no battery), Sheet Metal (parts), Illegible Notebook, Open Pack of Cigarettes, Pocket Vibrator (incomplete), Box of Matches.
Packet of Batteries Container and Box Item
It's one of those cheap brands that don't last very long, but it should suffice whether you're using a vibrator or powering a chainsaw
Gives 1-3 batteries when opened.
Found at Citizen's Home, Citizen's Tent, Derelict Villa, Duke's Villa, Home Depot, Looted Supermarket, Mini-Market, Small House.
On august 1, 2012
MadDonut

Repair: Tape Action
You can repair anything with some spit, grit, and a whole lot of duct tape.
Using Duct Tape with a broken melee weapon will repair it for one use only, the damage will remain the same. Once it's used, it will be destroyed forever into Unrecognizable Remains.
Possibly a Shunned, Armageddon Witness, and/or Hero only skill?
Rechargeable Battery Resource Item
This upgraded version of the Battery allows you to recharge it, but due to it's modifications it wont fit down a Battery Launcher's barrel.
Combine a Battery with an Electronic Component to make a Rechargeable Battery (uncharged).
"Recharge a Rechargeable Battery (uncharged)" when holding a Solar Panel to make a Rechargeable Battery (charged)
Used to power items like the Chainsaw, Radio Cassette Player, etc.
Cannot be used in any Battery Launchers.
1/5 chance of finding a Recharge Battery (uncharged) rather than a normal Battery.

Solar Panel Miscellaneous/Heavy Item
Recharge your batteries and your self-esteem!*
Combine 4 Electrical Component, 2 Duct Tape, 1 Twisted Plank to make a Solar Panel.
Each day, a Solar Panel starts with 3 'charges'. One charge is used each time you "Recharge a Rechargeable Battery".
*Hinting that you can recharge a vibrator with a Rechargeable Battery.

Wonder Remains Building
This weird place was a construction site for some sort of Wonder Building. You cant tell what it was, however, you do know that these kind of places can hide lots of good items since people gave offerends to the elusive World Beyond god in the past using these buildings.
Once explored can give any kind of items, with 100% chances.
It never becomes depleted.
Only one building per map (or none) and always spawns at 15Km+
Heavily guarded by zeds. (around 20 day1).

Citizen Professions
Unlike hero professions, these citizen professions will have pros and cons. Meaning that a normal citizen class will be in between the two of these classes and would thus be balanced out to where you could have a reason to not choose one of these and just be a normal citizen.
BuilderThis class would be geared towards the less adventurous type of citizen. You'd have a 10-15% chance of spending an extra AP on building or fixing a building in-town. They also have a higher chance of getting an extra AP off of dice and cards then everyone else due to them being in town so much and they have a higher chance of unlocking a safe or another item that's similar to it. Finally they have an one extra defense point to their home if it's built at least to a tent due to their knowledge of building things. Downsides to this class is that if the zombies manage to get into town you'll have a higher chance to have the status afterwards. All ways to kill zombies drop by roughly 5-10%, this percentage drop goes for camping in the world beyond as well. Drugs and booze are also less likely to give you extra AP, if at all. Finding something while scavenging is dropped by 5%, and they get in less steps.
Explorer If you choose this one you'll have a small buff of 5% to find something in the world beyond. You'll also have a 10-15% chance to add an extra AP into uncovering a building. When moving in the world beyond you have a VERY low chance to not use an AP and finally you have a sightly higher chance to kill a zombie with anything.

Camping is not effected in any way.

This class may seem great, but it's got some downsides. One of which being that everything that has a chance of breaking has a higher chance of doing so for the player. Drugs and booze are also less likely to give you extra AP, if at all. Unlocking a safe or something like it's chances are lowered in likely hood. And finally, the chances of your theft in someone's house being recorded are increased.
Collar & LeashIt's a dog collar and a leash, wonder what uses it has...This could have a lot of uses. It could be used to attack a zombie (Same chance of taking one down as the rusty chain.) or if at your home you could combine it with the rare watchdog to were having him in your inventory doesn't take up a space.
It can also be used to keep a shunned citizen in town and unable to leave the gates and do anything, but allowing them to build. A better use of a shunned citizen then just hanging, you'll have 12 AP spent towards building(due to them only able to take water from the well)! Wouldn't that be nice?

Seamen's Salted Nuts Food item
The packaging reads, "Nuts just aren't the same without that Seamen flavor. Made with real sea salt!".
Restores 6 .
Found at normal zones, Looted Supermarket, Mini-Market, Shady Bar, The 'Shattered Illusions' Bar, Plane Crash Site.
Crowbar Weapon Item
Good for prying open crates or undead skulls.
Opens Chest, Large Chest, Toolbox
90% To kill a zombie.
25% Chance to break.
Found at normal zones, Abandoned Construction Site, Construction Site Shelter, Deserted Freight Yard, Disused Warehouse, Home Depot, Smugglers' Cache, Warehouse, Wrecked Transporter.
RC Car (incomplete) Miscellaneous Item
If you get it into working condition, this little guy should be able to carry a few items.
Combine with Duct Tape, Electrical Component, Twisted Plank, Handful of Nuts and Bolts to create RC Car (Uncharged).
Found at normal zones, Abandoned Park, Burnt School, Duke's Villa, Small House.
RC Car (Charged) Miscellaneous Item
The small car can bring items back to town for you, but only as much as the little engine can take.
Found by combining a battery with a RC Car (uncharged)
Can carry three non-heavy items back to town for you, but the battery is used each trip.
Pawn Shop Ruin
From knick-knacks to firearms, this is your one-stop shop.
Here you can find Lawnmower, Swiss Army Knife, Box of Games, Safe, Sealed Architect's Chest, Bedside Lamp (off), Mini HiFi (broken), Persian Rug, Wad of Cash, Makeshift Barricade, Padlock and Chain, Machete, Incomplete Chainsaw, Kwik-Fix, Flatpacked Furniture, PUTA Mark II Calibrator, Revolver (empty), Machine Gun (empty).

Snazzy description.
It gives you status of blind which will make you a useless citizen.
Uses 6 ap and cures 1 unwanted status randomly.
"A Magical Drug that can cure everything except its side-effects"

Used for the Calibrated Catapult (Bungee Cord 2x) and the Coffin Catapult (Bungee Cord 3x).

Shoddy Bookshelf Furniture/Heavy Item
Now only if we had some books...
+1 Decoration points.
Adds an extra space in your chest for a non-heavy item.
8-Ball Miscellaneous Item
It is said that this ball allows you to see your future. Will it bring you luck or misfortune?
Allows you to regain 1 randomly, like the Dice or Incomplete Deck of Cards.
Slight chance to make you become Terrorized like the Incomplete Deck of Cards.
"You begin asking questions to the mystical ball. One of your questions is, 'What will happen tomorrow?'. The ball responds with, 'Purple'. Well, that's what you get for talking to an inanimate object."
"You begin asking questions to the mystical ball. One of your questions is, 'What will happen tomorrow?'. The ball responds with, 'Great things'. You're so overjoyed by the sphere's response that you've gained 1 !
"You begin asking questions to the mystical ball. One of your questions is, 'What will happen tomorrow?'. The ball responds with, 'You will die'. You're Terrorized by the sphere's response and begin trembling as you begin to think of all the horrible things that could happen to you tomorrow."
Found at normal zones, Burnt School, Fairground Stall, The 'Mayor-Mobile', Wrecked Transporter.

TailsTheeFox

If I'm allowed... Uh... Here's a suggestion. Old wooden shovelBalanced out and not meant to replace the scavenger... Just a rare item found in the land beyond.It's old, broken, and has some dried blood splatter on it from someone or something but if fixed up you could use it to make your searches in the desert less of a failure!

-Requires one wooden plank and some duct tape to fix
-When in the world beyond with this item in your rucksack, all your searches have a higher percentage of you finding something.
- It can be used to attack and kill a zed with a chance of it breaking, requiring you to use another twisted plank and duct tape.
-It does NOT improve searches while auto searching. Just the initial search.
-Stated above, this is a rare item and has the same chances of being found in the world beyond as booze.
-Although in the construction site shelter and construction site ruins this item is slightly less common then a hacksaw.
-Every time this item is used the chance of it breaking starts to rise. Starting at a low 10% and rising upon the seventh use to 70%. If managed to be used this many times, the next time it is used will always break it.

While your were searching it seems your Old Wooden Shovel has broken... You find nothing in your search as a added bonus to this fact.Although it's similar to the scavenger hero class... We do have car doors that give you one CP, much like a guardian class's two extra CP...

If you think it could use some tweaking, please say what and how.

Lighter (Item:weapon)
This old lighter appears to have a lot of fuel and the initials of the once proud owner have been scratched out to spell "crow". It can still start a fire though! (Desription)

If used, the chance of punching a zombie to death lower to 0% and the chance of surviving the night are lowered by 20% (due to zombies being on fire). Infection Modifiers:
Actions and things that can give players better or worse chances of surviving the night while being infected.
It could be something like:
Drunk: +10% chance to die of infection
Hangover: +5% chance to die of infection
Clean: -10% chance to die of infection
Ending day with 1 or more action points available: -5% chance to die of infection

You start as a normal cizinten,you have the basic clothing for die 2 nite,As you get more and more soul points you can get different colors of shirts and eventually hats like baseball hat/cowboy hat/Sergeant hat/mime hat/shades.You could unlock jackets and hoodies.There could be hero clothings that either would require SP or Hero days(HD).Hero special ones give a few defence like +5% chanche of not getting wounded when escaping,+5% chanche of surviving infection.If you get a big amount of a distinction you will get a cloth.(Like if you scaavange and fail a dirty shirt or if you steal alot a bandit cloak)And if heroes had them they gained small bonuses.You could see a persons clothing by checking theris sould OR seeing them outside town(not necessary) This would make Die 2 nite plain epic and would give me even more reasons to not be a inactive person.(Now im not since this game is a great time killer)

What do you guys say?If they made exploring buildings like that this shouldnt be hard,and they could start with a few clothing and start adding more and more styles.

I suggested new classes for resident which get some disadvantage.

recuited-builder
They have 7 APs / 6 APs after the attack.
They have world-beyond terrorized status which is worse than terrorized.(have a high change not to move to other zones)
Because of world-beyond terrorized status, they have 0 control point.
recuited-scavenger
They have 7 APs / 6 APs after the attack.
They can't work at construction sites.
If you think this is op class, they may have 0 control point and are unable to carry heavy object.

Still, ordinary resident can do both contruction and scavenging.

On august 30, 2012
Draink

Horse:

Can be used and act like a citizen's dehydration stats. Gains 1-2 CP for the zone.
Must be given a water ration once or once a two days to prevent dehydrated death.

Can be found in the following buildings:
Citizen's Tent
Mac's Atomic Cafe
Old Police Station

4 KM of use: Thirsty

12 KM of use: Dehydrated

15-18 KM of use: Death of the horse.

Rusted Car

To build the Rusted Car, you must first construct the basic car in the construction site for around 15-30. Once built, allows for an extra person in shotgun, and +4 inventory slots. When there is no extra person on board, you get +5!

Must be refilled after the Gas Can runs out of fuel.

One Gas Can can hold for around 14-16 KM

Can be modified in your house to have Sheet Metal added which gives an x amount of CP when outside. Base CP is 4 and 6 with Guardian.

Requires:
Engine.
x6 Twisted Planks
x6 Wrought Iron
x1 Belt
x1 gas can(new item!)

Item: Gas Can
Found in:
Wrecked Cars
Home Depot
Construction Site Shelter
Motorway Services

Rusty Bike:

Being rusty and old after all this time, it'll only go so far. Use it while you can to get where you need to go. It has no extra inventory slots.

Can ride for 5-8 KM and then turns BROKEN, can be fixed with a repair kit or kwik-fix.

Found in:
Looted Supermarket
Burnt School
Old Bicycle Hire Shop
Town Library
Home Depot
Wrecked Transporter


HyperDemon

Maybe a donkey or a goat too.

But they do half of what a horse does.

Example,

2KM of use: Thirsty

6KM of use: Dehydrated

9-7KM of use: Death.

Animals that are used for travel came be dropped in a zone by pressing a button to get off.

Machine powered transportation can be broken by the desert itself.


Just something off the top of my chaussette and watching DayZ veichle videos :S

On september 1, 2012
alwaysmetara

Small maps aren't ranked
I don't know, I was pretty glad when I finally got out of Small Maps. Though people always shovel dirt on distant maps for not being good at all, I still think they're much better than small maps. At least I stopped dying on Day 2 and 3 quite so much.
I was in small maps back before the attack curve was reevaluated (made much easier) and reevaluated again (made harder). Most importantly, I was in small maps before they made it so that towns aren't wiped out when the gates are open. Common occurrence in small maps in the good old days: Whole town dead on Day 3 because gates were open.
Now most of the town survives if that happens.
I agree that we should have a choice. This is the suggestion thread, right?
Yeah.
Okay, time for a suggestion of my own:

As you know, the world we are in is populated by normal, helpful people, but also the noobs, griefers, distinction hunters, and really weird people.
But worse of all, the inactives.
I'm not talking about the people who are usually active, but due to a stupid internet connection problem, dies an easily-preventable death. (Which has happened to me more times than is healthy )
I'm talking about those people who joins a town, and drinks water. Then ignore the game for a few days, then signs in, and drinks water.
Until they forget one time and die of dehydration.

This is just laughing in the face of the people who uses all their AP in useful ventures, read the forums, auto-searches for as long as they can, ration water thoughtfully with max benefit of AP, etc.

I'm pretty sure someone already mentioned something like this in another thread, but I've gone as far as to include some details in my idea of separating the inactives from the people who actually go on the game.

There's a point system. You get 'rated' every day with a max of 10 points per day. Only the past ten days you have been in a town counts. (Therefore, you can have a max of 100 points at any one time.)

Every day you get:
3 points for signing in

4 points for having at most 1 AP at the end of the day (to account for 1 AP left for gates but not used or while camping, having 1 AP left due to not being able to upgrade your campsite any longer.
Breakdown of points:
1 point per AP used for first three AP, then last point when you meet the requirement listed above

3 points for going on the town forums:
1 point for going to forum page
1 point for opening a thread
1 point for posting a reply

Total: 10 points.
You can get at most 10 points per day (getting 10 points really isn't hard if you're active) and only the last 10 days you were in a town counts, so you can have a max of 100 points.

When joining a town:
If you have 90 points or more, you can choose to 'Join a very active town' to only play with other people with 90 points or more
If you have 60 points or more, you can choose to 'Join an active town'.
Or you can choose to join a normal distant region, which is useful if you're in a meta-jump (I guess?)

These numbers can be modified depending on how long it takes for each kind of town to fill.
We can also decide how many of each kind of town there should be.

This would help the game a lot by making sure the active players play with other active players (instead of having a town with 20 people doing stuff and the other 20 sitting around and sipping a water ration now and then).
I guess this would take a while to implement but it'll really help.
Thanks!
On september 1, 2012

Crossbow/ Bow n Arrow (Weapon)

*

  • Usable to pinpoint a rotter in a zone with minimal noise, kills 1 zombie with a chance of the arrow being able to be reused.

*

  • *possibly* Can be used by a Scout and doesn't break camouflage, maybe a chance of 40-60% to get caught after one extermination.

*

  • Found at the Guns 'n' Zombies Armoury, Scottish Smith's Superstore, Warehouse, and Dark Woods *possibly more or less*

*

  • Bolts or arrows are needed for the weapon to work, can be carved out of a rotting log or twisted plank in the Workshop or found in the Scottish Smith's Superstore and Guns 'n' Zombies Armoury.
On september 24, 2012
ImbuedGreen

Suggestion: Infinite Post-editsPlayers who create a new topic can edit their original post infinitely.

Often times we players create informational posts for town organization or for helping noobs (item priority lists, daily construction plans, etc.), both in the Town Forums and the World Forums,

We are only given a short time-frame to edit out posts, which prevents easy alteration and forces players to constantly reply with/post a new, updated version of their original post.

This creates clutter in the forums and oftentimes confusion.

Having such a feature would, in my opinion, be immensely helpful.

Two ideas to add boundaries:

Add a new "Info" tag for posts in which infinite posts are allowed.

Add an SP requirement... Usually players with 1000+ SP have enough experience and knowledge of the game in which they would be posting-and-editing for beneficial purposes.

Crossbow/ Bow n Arrow (Weapon)

*


  • Usable to pinpoint a rotter in a zone with minimal noise, kills 1 zombie with a chance of the arrow being able to be reused.*

  • *possibly* Can be used by a Scout and doesn't break camouflage, maybe a chance of 40-60% to get caught after one extermination.*

  • Found at the Guns 'n' Zombies Armoury, Scottish Smith's Superstore, Warehouse, and Dark Woods *possibly more or less**
  • Bolts or arrows are needed for the weapon to work, can be carved out of a rotting log or twisted plank in the Workshop or found in the Scottish Smith's Superstore and Guns 'n' Zombies Armoury.

This seems like it would even it out, it not breaking at all.

On september 27, 2012
ImbuedGreen
kiwilukeexcept you will get people trying to reopen and close gates just before attack to get distinction or closing early and locking people out for it

I thought of that.
You take that sort of risk with all distinction-hunting though.

IMO, if someone is going to risk locking people out early, or risking the town's survival, then that "griefer" would have a better place to spend their 2AP, instead of using it on the gates. Not to mention, a player doing as you said would be characterized as any sort of griefer, and should be dealt with accordingly.
In a serious town with players who are interested in distinctions, the distinction wouldn't be worth it. If you want the distinction, sign up to be gatekeeper.

Perhaps make it so you don't get the distinction if you open AND close them within a certain time frame?

(i.e. Player 1 closes gates at the end of the day, say 5 minutes before attack. Soon after, Player 2 opens the gates and then re-closes immediately. Player 1 still gets the distinction.)

Role: Found in zones with pack of zombies or more, 50% chance of being in one.

Abilities: 2 CP, 1 more than the average 'zoe'

On october 9, 2012
coro

Oh, I was thinking more about the idea of finding discarded professional tools from past heroes... How about this: instead of finding "broken" versions of them that need fixing, you just have a rare chance of finding the real deal

Now, you may think that's overpowered. But what if there was a chance of the pro tool backfiring on you (since you aren't a real hero, and don't know how to use things properly)

- shovel can get stuck in the ground, no penalty on the 1:30 timer, but causes you to not find anything for that search
- shield takes damage when you move out of a zone with 3/4 zombies, shield needs to be fixed (in town, like building damage) or it will break (fixing a broken shield requires an actual guardian to spend AP and some materials)
- much higher chance of camo breaking when moving between zones; no safe actions
- still has the 90% cap on camping
- dog has a chance of not going to town, and dropping items in a zone infested with zombies; can't drug the dog
- rare chance of getting a hand or head injury when using CP; only gets 3 CP
- even more inaccurate sensing of souls; able to rain dance and heal, but will fail almost every time; can't make powerful souls

Messages Titles/Icons

After getting 1000 Messages distinctions, you earn the "Town Crier" title.

On november 3, 2012
MadDonut
VertigoProcessThey would have to fix the forum distinctions first. Not to mention I think they didn't make titles for posts to prevent people spamming for distinctions.

Agreed. I just wanted to make a suggestion. I haven't had much creativity juice since I made this thread.

But that ends now! Ladies and gentlemen, I present to you...

Die2nite [Urban] Map Setting
You managed to survive in the harsh desert, but can you survive the urban jungle? Now with extra zombies!
Increase in zombies (both at attack and in zones).
New metropolis theme!
New ruins!
New [Urban] specific items!

Basically, it's an add-on to Die2Nite that has similar mechanics, but with the twist of it being set in a once densely populated city. Future updates could include Die2Nite [Tropical], Die2nite [Mountainous], and Die2nite [Forest], each type having their own pros and cons. This would be a big leap (especially with the issues the normal D2N already has), but I think it would be a cool idea to implement in the future.
On november 3, 2012
BlackVoid

Yeah, If I saw those feature implemented 10-20 years from now it'd be a big step forward for MT.

On november 4, 2012
MadDonut
065tdsa

I heard of a die2nite in jungle and tundra settings before, somewhere. Not sure who posted it, but it wasn't that long ago. I wasn't quite sure about that suggestion.

Urban would surely be good though (at least the way i imagine it), and any of this would be a huge leap for the game (and we would a ton of bugs, but heck, looking at the bright side is good).

I could probably go for hours writing a bunch of stuff that could be included in Die2nite [Urban], but I don't see it being worthwhile unless a bunch more people support the idea. No point in a ton of suggestions for something that won't exist.

However, I do have suggestions for Random Events. These can occur whenever you search a zone. Here's an example:
Corpse in the Sand Random Event
If found, the following prompt pops up:
"As you search through the dunes, you discover a body partly submerged face-down in the sand. You can't quite tell if it's just a body of a dehydrated traveler or an undead landmine. Do you dare to approach it?" [Approach] [Ignore]
If you choose to ignore it:
"Deciding the risk is too great, you leave it be."
If you choose to approach it, two things can happen. It could turn out to be a zombie and attack you with an 80% chance to injure you (a new zombie will then appear in the zone) unless you are equipt with a melee weapon, or you will be able to loot the body.
"You carefully approach the corpse...
As you flip it over, it suddenly comes alive! The zombie lurches forward, dragging you to the ground. After a brief tussle, you manage to break free of the undead's grasp. Unfortunately, it has injured your (body part)."
"You carefully approach the corpse...
As you flip it over, it suddenly comes alive! The zombie lurches forward, dragging you to the ground. After a brief tussle, you manage to break free of the undead's grasp. Somehow, you come out unscathed!"
"You carefully approach the corpse...
As you flip it over, it suddenly comes alive! The zombie lurches forward, dragging you to the ground. Quickly, you pull out your (melee weapon) and kill the zombie, breaking free of it's grasp. As you breath a sigh of relief, you notice a rucksack laying under it's corpse. You open it to find a (rare item)! "
"You carefully approach the corpse...
As you flip it over, it remains completely motionless. As you breath a sigh of relief, you notice a rucksack still clutched in it's arms. You open it to find a (rare item)!
Once you ignore or loot the body, the event will end with this:
"The wind starts picking up and you cover your eyes from the harsh, sandy wind. Once the sudden gust ends you look back at the body only to see that it had been covered by the freshly blown sand, never to be seen again.
On november 4, 2012
alwaysmetara

Which also means more zombies!

Soundwave

Just wanted to put a link to the Great wastes idea I'd suggested, to bring it to the attention of the creators.

Great wastes
On november 6, 2012
MadDonut

The Crow Random Event
If found, the following prompt pops up:
"As you search through the dunes, you hear a crow cawing nearby. Spinning around, you spot the creature sitting quietly on a branch of a dead tree. Do you dare to approach it?" [Approach] [Ignore]
If you choose to ignore it:
"Deciding the risk is too great, you leave it be. The crow in return beats it's wings and majestically flies off into the distance."
If you choose to approach it, the crow will fly over you and either terrorize you, give you an item, or er.. something else.
"You carefully approach the crow...
As you near the tree, The crow flutters into the air, cawing madly. You foolishly try to flee as it dives down, raking it's black talons into your flesh. You scream and roll in the sand as it repeatedly claws and pecks you. Eventually, the crow leaves, satisfied by your screams of pain. You sit up, completely Terrorized by the experience!"
"You carefully approach the crow...
As you near the tree, The crow flutters into the air and circles around you. Suddenly, an item plummets from it's talons and onto the sand in front of you. You curiously walk forward and pick up the object. It turns out to be a (rare item)! You stare at the sky and silently thank the bird as it majestically flies off into the distance."
"You carefully approach the crow...
As you near the tree, The crow flutters into the air and circles around you. Suddenly, your face becomes covered in something cool, but as you lift your hand to wipe it off, you realize it's sticky as well. The great mighty crow has just shat on you. Completely demoralized, you hang your head down in shame as the crow majestically flies off into the distance."

Speaking of feces...
Toilet Plunger Weapon
Useful for getting rid of those dastardly party poopers.
15% chance to kill a zombie.
35% chance to break.
"You dash forward and swing as hard as you can, but alas it's as hopeless as killing a zombie with a Toilet Plunger."
"You dash forward and swing as hard as you can. The undead foe falls over, hitting it's forehead on a rock. As it turns to get back up, you plunge the Toilet Plunger into his face and suck his brains out of the gaping wound.
If successful, the following message will appear in the zone's history:
(Playername) has somehow sucked the brains out of a zombie with a Toilet Plunger! Whoa!
Plumber Distinction/Title
Awarded to a player each time they kill a zombie with a Toilet Plunger
Declogger - Attain 5 'Plumber' distinction.
Sexy Plumber - Attain 10 'Plumber' distinctions.
Porcelain Lobotomist - Attain 15 'Plumber' distinctions.
On november 6, 2012
Feanor
MadDonutAll birds have talons silly.
Talon - A claw, esp. one belonging to a bird of prey.
I've been shit on by a bird before and I distinctly remember it being cold.

Not all birds are 'a bird of prey' though.

Birds are endothermic. They create their own body heat separate from their environment. So a bird could defecate either hot or cold and anywhere in-between depending on it's current metabolism.

But back on topic:
I do like the idea for the random event in TWB. Wouldn't really effect game-play much but would be a good flavor element to add
On november 11, 2012
MadDonut

Medkit Container
Injuries are bound to happen, so be prepared!
When opened, it can contain a Bandage, Hydratone 100mg, Paracetoid 7g, Valium Shot, or Twinoid 500mg.
Found at Ambulance, Destroyed Pharmacy, Nuclear Bunker, and Old Field Hospital.
Snoozium 50mg Drug
For when you're having trouble sleeping as the hordes eat your townmates alive.
Made by combining a Valium Shot, Pharmaceutical Products, and Battery.
You can use it to drug your townmates like you would with a Vial of Poison, but they wont die. Once taken, it cures and stops you from being Terrorized, makes you Exhausted, and keeps you from gaining any until the attack is over.
"After you ingest the (drugged item), you become extremely tired. You lay down and try to stay awake for as long as you can, but as you become sleepier, you also become much calmer. You've been drugged by one of your townmates!"

On november 14, 2012
Jazster

New drink/food ideas:

Coke: Restores 7 and drops a thirst level.
Premium water: Restores 6 and drops a thirst level.
Spoiled Hotdog: Restores 6
Burger: Restores 7
Sushi: Restores 6
Candy cane (x-mas event food item) Restores: 10
Pizza Restores: 7
Energy drink: Restores 8 and makes you thirsty.
Raw fish: Restores 6 and 40% chance of infection
Cooked fish: Restores 7
Salad: Restores 6
Worms: Restores 6, and 50% chance of terrorised. (Survivalists will have a 0% terrorised rate)
Atomic drug: Restores 18 but makes you drunk, hangover, infection, dehydrated, 33% chance to kill you.
Cake: Restores 7
Lovely Zed: Restores: 6, 15% chance to turn you into a ghoul, and makes you terrorised.
Mysterious meat: Restores 6 and has a 7.5% chance to turn you into a ghoul.
Glorious Dinner: Restores 100 but you will die in 30 seconds. (Actully don't implement this one its a joke! XD)
On november 14, 2012
Jazster

Shaman buff: The shaman can now do a ritualistic dance to mazmorize other citizens to have +1 or 2 each! You may use this ability once every 3 days.

Survivalist buff: Max is now raised to 7! (Food and water restores 7 each and premium food now gives you 8

Technician buff: The technician can now repair an item a day for free!

Tamer buff: Your little dog has become stronger and may now carry +1 item!!!
On november 14, 2012
MadDonut

This idea was originally from this thread.

Psychic Sense Shaman Ability
Afraid of who's eating your fellow town-mates? Search them out using your spiritual senses!
Using a Weak Soul once per day, a Shaman can use his Psychic Sense to detect ghouls with a 60% chance of failure and if you fail you become terrorized. Each success adds only one letter to the traitor's name. I shall use my own username in the sample text bellow.
"You hold the soul within your hand and gaze at it's fiery form. You then inhale deeply, in-taking the soul to see what knowledge you can gain from the dead. You hear a raspy voice echo a name, but you can only figure out the following letters of the citizen's name: M _ _ _ _ _ _ _"
"You hold the soul within your hand and gaze at it's fiery form. You then inhale deeply, in-taking the soul to see what knowledge you can gain from the dead. You hear a raspy voice echo a name, but it suddenly cuts off into loud screams and desperate cries. You feel the cold, icy hands of the dead tearing your flesh apart. You suddenly snap out of your trance, completely Terrorized from the experience!"

On november 14, 2012
Jazster

Ritualistic Sacrifice Altar: (Only shamans can use this)
This building costs 12 to make x2 sheet metal, x4 wooden planks, and is a permanent building, but the shaman can only use it once every 3 days. When you build this, the shaman can sacrifice any kind of item to the crow, if success the crow will give you up to x10 water ration, up to x5 random premium food and x3 rare item (in bank). The better item, the better chance of success.
For example... (All items in your inventory will be sacrificed!) *%= chance of success*

*EDIT: If by chance you have built the crow statue, all sacrifices are free and have 100% of success.* (However you may only do this every 7 days.)

1-2 Defensive items: 20%
3-4 Defensive items: 28%
4 Normal Food: 15%
4 premium food: 25%
3-4 Drugs: 33%
4 Random items: 1-5%
Shaman uses 6 to sacrifice his inventory items.

RESULT!

Fail: The Crow flies by, glaring at your pathetic sacrifice, he then obliterates all your sacrifices, and shuns all shamans. (Shunned shamans also cannot sacrifice anymore.)

Success: The crow flies by, and is joyed by your sacrifices and decides to drop a random number of water rations, premium food and best of all, a rare item! The crow then flies away with his sacrifices and disperses into the world beyond...

Dried-Up Lake Ruin
There used to be large pits of water that covered the World Beyond, but they all were depleted once the sands began taking over. All that remains now is a small boathouse and a few out of place boats.
Here you can find a Plastic Bag, Electrical Component, Water Pistol, Manbag, Box of Games, Chest, Packet of Soft Crisps, Dried Marshmallows, Doggy Bag, Wire Mesh, Padlock and Chain, Aqua-Splash (Incomplete), Jerrycan Pump, Engine (Incomplete), Radio Cassette Player (no battery), Stagnant Water Can, Huge Snake (Ophiophagus trouser), Instruction Manual, Opened Pack of Cigarettes, and Groundsheet.

Requires: Foundations

Costs: 60, 5 Metal Supports, 5 Patchwork Beams, 2 Sheet Metal.
We've set it up so the watchmen tonight will be sacrificing themselves for the greater good. Nobody is expecting them to make it out of this shift alive, but they should be able to take out a good hundred or zombies before they go down. Want to draw straws?

On november 17, 2012
adameltablawy

I have an idea, but a bit off topic.
Well, quite simply it's another soul idea.
No, don't close the browser just yet.
Here it is:
Golden Soul.
All citizens have a 1% chance of becoming a golden soul. Heroes have a 4% chance.
Golden souls are like regular souls, but different. For one, they cannot be made into powerful souls.
Thing is, when you die, rather than being a weak soul you might become a golden soul. If this happens, you don't get the "You died in the world beyond/poison/town/meat locker/cyanide/drugs or whatever death picture. Instead, you appear one space from your town, in form. Seriously, we could use that picture as the sprite. In any case, as a golden soul, you have one inventory space and can carry no heavy items. Or speak to other players on the town forum in anything besides a few words. (Shamans can remove this and let you speak normally). You also cannot eat or drink or take drugs, as you have no mouth or body parts with which to inject yourself.

But, there are plenty of bonuses that come with it. For one, you can still move around, and have 10 rather than six, and these are restored daily.

Another is that at the cost of four you can annihilate three zombies in a zone. Shamans can use you to destroy all of them in a zone, but this can only be used once per game. As a golden soul, you can project some of the wisdom you have picked up in the afterlife to discover a rare to very rare blueprint once every four days. You can also possess items in the world beyond for a bit of extra use (Water or food restoring one Ap more, a weapons having a higher kill chance rate or lower break rate, ect) The downside to this is that if a citizen picks up possessed decoration items (Cursed cuddly toy, anyone?) they will become terrorised. Same with weapons or whatnot, but a MUCH lower chance (5%). You also cannot do this more than once per day, and you leave items if they are eaten, drunk, or broken. You cannot do this to animals. If you so wish, you could sacrifice yourself to halfway finish the largest defense construction (Or in the case where the water reserves are in danger, the largest water addition construction). The halfway is in respect to the remaining amount of AP. if 400 ap remain, you do 200, but if there are 60 left out of 400, you will add 30.
You also get a distinction for being a golden soul.
Shamans can use you to greater effect than normal souls, and you will not vanish. They can't just keep using you multiple times per day, however. A few of the shaman actions are detailed on the wiki.
You can also attempt to relieve a person of their status effects, or boost a shaman's success chance in doing the same.
Don't forget, this is die2nite, so this WILL inevitably be used to grief, so here are a few things:
Golden souls can also attack citizens with a 50% terrorization chance, but this costs 6 AP and can only be done every two days. Why? YOU ARE A GHOST. IT IS TO BE EXPECTED.

Other than that, you cannot really affect anything. You cannot join the watchmen. You can get estimates on the town watchtower. If you are a hero, you can use your hero powers. You can vote for upgrades. You cannot build. You cannot get infected, or drunk, dehydrated or hooked or drugged. (Reason? You can't use the items to do that.) You cannot affect control points in a zone other than using yourself as a weapon.

How you die:
Well, if left alone in the world beyond at night and you didn't attempt to camp or head back to town, you will drift apart and become a weak soul. If the town is devastated and there are no other citizens, you die. If you finish a construction project or the crow devours you, you die. And if someone makes a mini Hi-Fi, you leave for another town in disgust. (No, seriously.) Upon death, you leave behind two water rations and a cursed cuddly toy.

This seems overpowered, until you notice the incredibly low chances of becoming one. It's like LMS of the dead.

It's up to you guys to correct as you wish, improve as you wish, and come up with achievement names and dialogue for the options.
On november 17, 2012
Jazster

Since theres a portal lock, foundations, watchtower, workshop etc. Why not make a technological building?
It takes only 20 Wrought iron to build. 30
It's a parent tree of these:

Technology: Improved well propulsion system: Every day, the well produces a free 2 water rations after the attack. Needs 1 motor and 2 wooden planks. 25 to build

Technology: Improved firearms system: Weapons now can knock out 2 zombies more. Needs 1 motor, 8 wrought iron and 16 wooden planks. 150 to build.

Technology: Orbital Sky Bombardment system: The citizens have now developed a new way of attacking the zombies, from above, of course! Temporary Building Needs 4 metal supports, 8 wooden planks and 16 wrought iron. Needs 60 to build. 120

Technology: Energy beam: Epic. Laser. Of. Doom!! To build: 5 electronic component, 14 wrought iron, 12 wooden planks, 1 motor. 150 to build. Provides 100 and town gains 10 each day.

Alsssso, finnaly, technican buff!

Release your inner technological self! You can now invent things, however, there is a specific recipe for such items. Your now so technologically advanced that, every 2 invested into a technological building, once the building is done, it receives a technican bonus of 5 per 2 (only technicans ap). Once every 2 days, after day 10, you may develop a recipe, and build either a motor/chainsaw from scratch! Also, make use of your buildings! On every building there is a tech-meter, say the technican uses 6CP, then it is converted into 6!
On november 17, 2012
Jazster

New Town Idea:

Chaos Town Must have 200+ points to join.

Description: Ready to join the chaos? This town is already in chaos mode! Being Last Man Standing here gains x3 hero days than normal! Construction sites now need 1.5% more !
.....................................................

Armageddon Town Must have 300+ to join.

Description: You now have a 0% chance of survival when camping (Up to 60% for ), 100% death rate when infection, and the moment that you are infected you have a 50% chance of infecting another citizen! Ghouls can now eat 2 people per day! Now there are only 10 water rations in the well, and now town upgrades are incredibly nerfed. The horde of zombies is extremely brutal that all rules that apply to hardcore also apply to Armageddon towns, and the horde is now 80% more bigger. Watchman's are guaranteed to get terrorised AND injured and have a 75% chance of death. All DO's will be destroyed after the attack, regardless where it is! To get last man standing in this town, your town must have survived for at least 2 days. 3 hero days after everyday after day 7. You also get a distinction for being last man standing in an Armageddon town.

*does some calculation*

The Chaos town doesn't really make a difference except that you can pillage a lot, you can't shun griefers, you can't see where people are in the World Beyond, and you need more AP for constructions, apparently. 3x the hero days for LMS would generate some serious selfish play to the point that everyone gets killed Day 2.

065tdsa

I heard of a die2nite in jungle and tundra settings before, somewhere. Not sure who posted it, but it wasn't that long ago. I wasn't quite sure about that suggestion.

Urban would surely be good though (at least the way i imagine it), and any of this would be a huge leap for the game (and we would a ton of bugs, but heck, looking at the bright side is good).

Tundra, where zombies die from fire and citzens die of cold and restore AP with a torch that can be acquired by visiting the town's fireplace.

Urban, where zombies die from clean air, since they got the virus from polution and citzens need breathable air to survive and restore AP and get it from...heck, I really don't know...

But the urban theme is really interesting. The "World Beyond" would be the oposite of the desert, with the streets crowded with zeds and lots of ruins to explore. The streets would need to be cleared so the ruins could be rached.

Damn, I want Die2Nite Urban.
On november 19, 2012
MadDonut
Tiforce

But the urban theme is really interesting. The "World Beyond" would be the oposite of the desert, with the streets crowded with zeds and lots of ruins to explore. The streets would need to be cleared so the ruins could be rached.

Damn, I want Die2Nite Urban.

Damn, now I want to make some ideas for it.

Here's a nice fleshed out version of the idea.

Die2Nite [Urban]
You managed to survive in the harsh desert, but can you survive the urban jungle? Now with extra zombies!
Towns are renamed Strongholds.
Somewhere, there is a city that takes up a majority of the map. Your Stronghold could perhaps spawn right in the middle of the city or even on the far edges.
The following zones appear within the city area: Normal Scavenging Zone, Building, Polluted, Ruin.
The following zones appear outside the city area: Normal Scavenging Zone, Ruin.
They all spawn (somewhat) randomly.
Normal Scavenging Zone
The same sandy empty space you would find in a normal Die2Nite map, but maybe the ones within the city should look like buried streets. Also, your oxygen will only refill here and at the Stronghold.
Ruin
Also just like the normal Die2nite ones, but the ruins that are in the city should be more urban based than the ones on the outskirts. (Depleted Building, Disused Car Park vs Once Inhabited Cave, Collapsed Mineshaft) Wont deplete oxygen but wont refill it either.
Building
Buildings that are far too looted to be a full-on ruin. The zone looks like random generic buildings, but works like a Normal Scavenging Zone that takes longer to deplete. They also spawn zombies, but in lower amounts than a Ruin (Unless in Hardcore). Wont deplete oxygen but wont refill it either.
Polluted
Zones within the city can randomly be heavily polluted by things such as piles of corpses, busted sewer lines, or chemical fires. These zones begin to deplete your oxygen levels when entered. When you camp in a Polluted Ruin, and only in Polluted Ruins, your oxygen refills and your it wont deplete. Although, if you do leave your hiding place and then re-camp in the same day, your oxygen wont deplete but wont refill it either. Your oxygen level will be the same the following day so beware if you try to re-camp in the same Polluted Ruin the same day with low oxygen. (Explorable Ruins can't be in Polluted zones to avoid confusion and such) All citizens have +2 CP. (Only +1 in Hardcore)
All citizens have +50% oxygen. (Only +25% in Hardcore)
Requires 500 to join. (750 to join Hardcore)
Attacks are twice as large.
for some constructions are less. (Less is less in Hardcore)

Redo Suggestion:

Armageddon Town! (x2 hero days awarded for lms)

In the Armageddon towns, the zombies have already infested alot of zones! Construction projects now cost +10% .
If you become a ghoul, once you eat someone, you die. Attacks are much worse, as they are 25% higher than normal! To make any upgrades to a house (bed->tent and so on), they now cost 6! Defensive objects WILL be destroyed if left in the bank, chaos mode now starts when there are 20 citizens left! When you are ,,or you are not allowed to go outside. To get shunned you now only need 6 complaints, EVERYTHING will be taken away from you. Watchmen have a maximum of 85% survival, and a 15% chance of injury or terrorized. Citizens now have only 1 control point, guardians 3. The gates now take 3 to close. And now, to become devastated, 5 citizens or less must still be alive, and be in town, or the other way around. Daily upgrades are siginficantly reduced! Weapons now have a 30% chance of breakage, regardless of what it is. Once you get injured, you also get infected. Infection has a staggering 85% chance of death! Also, all citizens cannot upgrade to the tent before day 3! Are you ready for a realistic die2nite? are you grieving for an end to this world? THEN JOIN AN ARMAGEDDON TOWN!

Requires 500+ SP to join.
Oh and, P.S if just 1 zombie gets in, havoc will be dispersed into the town, making 0-4 citizens die, for each zombie that leaks.

On november 26, 2012
coro

An idea I was going to post in this thread, which I call Purgatory mode

It would basically be the same map type as a non-distant region, but with these differences:
only 20 people
everyone in the town has 3 lives
heroes have access to a fixed subset of hero unlocks (regardless of days accrued)
people with 100+ SP can join the town after the town's first day has been extended
after day 5, constructions start to take damage (have the gazette mention something about the zombies getting more violent)
you get no distinctions/SP from being in these towns (just experience playing the game)


New players would be forced to play in Purgatory, but only once. After their first town is finished, then they are offered a choice of continuing in Purgatory, or playing in a "real" town (AKA, a small map)

Whenever you die, you get the typical death screen, but with a bit more information about what one should do to prevent this from happening

Dying works exactly the same (a meaty bone only appearing after one's final death..?), but after dying, you get the profession choice screen (maybe let heroes play a different class at this point?). After death, you're reincarnated in town. Being eaten during the attack is a perma-death (to encourage people to actually build defense)


This idea can work without the multiple lives, but for some reason, I feel like that would help new players get hooked by the game (rather than get mad and leave when they die for a dumb reason)
