GHOUL UPGRADE:
When passing a zone full of undead, the ghoul has a chance of blending in. Considering the ghoul has the adequate hygiene and appearance of the normal day zombie, the might blend in.

Chances of blending in decrease with every zombie in this zone by 10-20%

The level of "blending in" may start at 90%, 5 zombies are in your zone. The excess zombies total 3 (if a citizen), that would make the % decrease either to 60% or 30%.

The chances of this happening may be altered.

On november 29, 2012
MadDonut

I know some people find the Shaman out of place with his magic and spells, but I think that could be solved with a 'reskin' of sorts. I think the following idea would make the profession darker and slightly more realistic.

Mortician Profession
With his vast experience with corpses before and after the apocalypse, the Mortician has gained many death-related skills which makes him a very useful character when the world is plagued with the living dead.
This is what he looks like.
He has the same exact skills as a Shaman, but less about spells and rituals and more about the paranormal and The Crow. The Mortician uses Traveler's Corpses rather than souls. Here's some of the flavor text redone so it works with the Mortician:
Curing drunk - You unsheath your large dark knife and begin to ¬´prepare¬ª following a well-practised sequence of routine movements. Your intuition guides you and without hesitation you make an incision just beside the liver. As a clear liquid leaks from their freshly mutilated body, [CITIZEN] is freed from the clutches of alcohol.
Curing infection - You unsheath your large dark knife and begin to ¬´prepare¬ª following a well-practised sequence of routine movements. Your intuition guides you and without hesitation you make an incision at the base of the infected limb. The decontamination process is underway, albeit slowly.
Failing to cure injury That's impossible... you've forgotten where to cut and your intuition fails to guide you. The risk of killing [CITIZEN] is too great. Here are some of the Shaman constructions and items, but redone to fit the Mortician.
Plague Mask Profession Item
This antique mask, which has been used by early plague physicians for thousands of years, allows the Mortician to know exactly where the corpses of freshly-deceased citizens are located in the World Beyond.
Works like the Voodoo mask, but detects Traveler's Corpses rather than souls. Traveler's Corpse Food Item
This corpse isn't in the best of shape: the worms have already eaten a decent amount of whoever it was... Are you sure you want to wander around with this monstrosity on your shoulders?
Works the same as it did before, but now spawns like souls as well.
Can be converted into an Embalmed Corpse at the Workshop by a Mortician. Embalmed Corpse Miscellaneous Item
The Mortician used all his effort to make this dead body look alive as possible. It's nose is made out of a dead rotten rat and it's arm is made out of a few splinters of wood, but hey, it's the best they could do.
Used in Mortician constructions and Make it rain!
(Success) "You lay the body down in a clearing. Soon, you hear the flapping of wings as a large black bird lands on your offering. The creature plucks into it's rib and pulls out a large brown organ and proceeds to dine on it. The bird, finished with his meal, flies into the sky and disappears behind a lone cloud. Suddenly, a heavy rain pours atop the town from the grey puff above."
(Failed) "You lay the body down in a clearing. Soon, you hear the flapping of wings as a large black bird lands on your offering. The creature plucks into it's rib and pulls out a large brown organ and proceeds to dine on it. The bird finishes his meal, but you notice it seems disgusted. The feathered beast spreads his wings and takes off into the empty sky." Better Scarecrows Construction
With the help of a skilled Mortician, the town can make the Scarecrows several times more realistic and effective.
Replaces XXL Voodoo Doll.
The original Scarecrows would be moved under Emergency Supplies.
Provides 65 Defense.
Requires 20, 10 Twisted Planks, 3 Duct-Tape, and 2 Embalmed Corpses. Scarecrows must be built. The Super Survivor Construction
What appears to the horde as a super-powered citizen is actually just a corpse on a system of pulleys. It might not seem too effective as it swings madly through the air, but it scares off some of the zombies and sometimes manages to whack one in the head.
Replaces Spirit Mirage.
Provides 80 Defense.
Requires 30, 6 Twisted Planks, 6 Wooden Beams, 2 Handfuls of Nuts and Bolts, 1 Embalmed Corpse. Emergency Supplies must be built. The Last Supper Construction
Nothing pleases a crow more than a grand feast in his honor. A pleased crow is also a very giving crow. Just don't get too close to him as he eats...
Replaces Holy Raincloud.
Provides 200 Defense.
Requires 40, 5 Twisted Planks, 10 Wooden Beams, 4 Embalmed Corpses. Emergency Supplies must be built. Sword of Bokor Construction
Using this evil looking guillotine and crudely reconstructed corpse, the mortician can cut off the head of a pack-leader zombie at a distance, causing those who follow it to turn and wander back into the desert.
Provides 100 Defense
Requires 60, 6 Wooden Beams, 5 Metal Supports, 3 Sheet Metal, 3 Embalmed Corpses. Emergency Supplies must be built.
Also, here's a previous suggestion for the Shaman, but changed as well.

Paranormal Senses Mortician Ability
Afraid of who's eating your fellow town-mates? Search them out using your otherworldly senses!
Using a Traveler's Corpse once per day, a Mortician can use his Paranormal Sense to detect Ghouls with a 60% chance of failure. If you fail you become terrorized. Each success adds only one letter to the traitor's name. I shall use my own username in the sample text bellow.
"You examine the body carefully and check it for bite marks. You then shut your eyes, to see what knowledge you can gain from the dead. You hear a raspy voice echo a name, but you can only figure out the following letters of the citizen's name: M _ _ _ _ _ _ _"
"You examine the body carefully and check it for bite marks. You then shut your eyes, to see what knowledge you can gain from the dead. You hear a raspy voice echo a name, but it suddenly cuts off into loud screams and desperate cries. You feel the cold, icy hands of the dead tearing your flesh apart. You then snap out of your trance, completely Terrorized from the experience!"

What do you guys think?

Heeey, got some more ideas!

Sandy Fortress *Uncommon Blueprint*

150 Temporary Building! Needs 75 to build.

Needs: 5 sand balls, 10 wooden planks, 2 wrought iron.

.................................................

Super catapult *Rare Blueprint* 10 Needs 380 to build.

Needs: 2 wooden planks, 10 wrought iron, 2 electronic components.

Hey hey! Y'know, why not just make a gigantic catapult to catapult our junk on the zombies... it has to be effective, right?

Takes 2 to catapult an item, shunned can't do it, any item catapulted will be 2 temporary, but if we have fortifications, 20 t temporary for each item catapulted! But beware, if the catapult reaches a whopping 500+ in temporary defense, the catapult will self-destruct has a 80% chance to injure 1/4 of the town.
..................................................

Needs: 3 nuts and bolts, 3 electronic component, 2 sheet metal, 18 wrought iron, 12 wooden planks, and 3 iron supports.

New Building

Fallen Town

Items:

Resources:
Wrought Iron
Twisted Plank
Metal Support
Patchwork Beam
Sheet Metal

Items:
Doggy Bag
Water Ration
Meaty Bone
Traveller's Corpse

Weapons:
Broken Machete
Broken Hurling Stick
Water Pistol (empty)
Battery Launcher (empty)

Camping Rating:
Level 6

MAY BE REBUILT FOR A COST OF 30-50

If rebuilt the following will be created
Town Gates (base 10 )
The Bank (may only store 5 objects)

Jazster

Y'know I got so many ideas bursting out of my head, and this is the thread to just make them explode ...

No, I'm not griefing.

ANYWAY! got some more ideas for y'all..

Radiation Shack 100 (Foundations) *Rare Blueprint*

Y'know what'd be good? A radiation shack so we'll all be infected, but we don't die of infection? Yes! But the pure reason why we built this is to radiate a special radiation to detroriate the zombies, make them explode, to put it down simply.

Needs: x2 parcetoid, x2 the things that can make you injured and get you masochisim distinction, x10 wrought iron, x12 wooden planks. 130 to build.

.............................................

Structural Improvements: (Foundations/Workshop) *Uncommon Blueprint* (This building makes every building contribute an extra 15% of what it's worth, even buildings built after this!

One day, a citizen simply said "why not put extra components to buildings" The other citizens thought it would be a good idea, so here it is!

Needs: x4 nuts and bolts, x12 iron supports, x14 wooden planks, x16 wrought iron, x1 electronic component, x24 rotting logs. 170 to build!

.............................................

Gigantic Christmas Tree: (Foundations) *Very Rare Blueprint* [You may only get this blueprint between November 25 through January 5. Each time atleast 1 zombie gets into town, this structure has a chance of providing 200-350Temporary , then if it does give defense, it must be given 40 to rebuild, otherwise it will be destroyed next attack if a zombie gets through.

Hey, y'know we should just make a gigantic christmas tree, except put it in the middle of the town, and if we're lucky, some zombies may be attracted to the christmas tree, and then we can kill them by surprise the next morning! Sound like a plan?! However... we don't got any christmas things, NO MATTER! WE SHALL MAKE THE CHRISTMAS TREE OF PURE WROUGHT IRON!!

Needs: x100 wrought iron. Needs 100.

On december 3, 2012
MadDonut

Some suggestions for the Die2Nite [Urban] suggestion.

Collapsed Subway Station Ruin
The tunnels have long since collapsed and filled with sand, but a few subway trains remain stationary, their motors sand-worn and fried. Maybe some of these immobilized cars have valuable loot still trapped inside...
Only found in the city on [Urban] maps.
Here you can find a Metal Support, Electrical Component, Broken Electronic Device, Battery, Mobile Phone, Pathetic Penknife, Serrated Knife, Sheet Metal, Unshaped Concrete Blocks, Dried Chewing Gum, Packet of Soft Crisps, Doggy Bag, Wad of Cash, Unlabeled Drug, Engine (incomplete), Giant Rat, A letter with no address, and Opened Pack of Cigarettes. Housing Complex Explorable Ruin
The abandoned homestead of low income families who survived on a paycheck to paycheck biases. Now that you think of it, not all that much has changed really.
Only found in the city on [Urban] maps.
Here you can find a Duct Tape, Pathetic Penknife, Serrate Knife, Wonky Shopping Trolley, Safe, Mattress, Table, J√§rpen Table, Guard Dog, Chinese Noodles, Can, Door Mat, Mini Hi-Fi (broken), Carcinogenic Oven, Padlock and Chain, Radio Cassette Player (no battery), Flatpacked Furniture, Giant Rat, Incomplete Deck of Cards, Pocket Vibrator (incomplete), Kwik-Fix, and Sheet of Plywood.

L.O.L Radio: (Available Apr.1) Found anywhere, 100% chance to find (with another item with it!), only 1 per town, uses 6 to attack, kills 6-10 zombies.

Inedible Candy: (Available Dec.1-Dec.25) Limit 1 per town, found atleast 10 to the town, 100% chance to break, 100% chance to kill 43 zombies.

On december 6, 2012
Jazster

More suggestions..

New class...

Designer: The masticator of zombies! Superior to all, he will PWN! Actully, the designer has a 12.5% chance every day of finding a common-uncommon blueprint. Unfortunately, he has to use his mind in very unorthodox ways, so he must use all his when he thinks to try to make his own blueprint. The designer cannot build a blueprint if he's injured, infection, ghoulified, drunken, drugged, or hooked... it makes him distracted. However, when he camps, he is insipred due to the amazing world beyond . Thus, makes him have a 25% chance to make a common/uncommon blueprint, pottentialy, if he camps, and SURVIVES everyday, this effect will be permanent. However, this class has some disadvantages, if he attacks a zombie whether using his armageddon abillity, heroic uppercut, a normal weapon, he has a 33% chance of injuring himself, of course he designed good weapons, but never learned to use them. However, once he uses his thinking, he will be exhausted, will not regain from water ration/drug/food etc., but water will still relieve thirst. Also, if the designer is shunned , he cannot build blueprints. NOTE! If somehow your town is legendary, and run out of uncommon/common blueprints, the designer, will now make rare/very rare blueprints, however the chance of this is 5.5%. Also, three times per town, he may use his nagging abillity, learned from the designer school, to hault all to a specific construction for 3 days, this will be so useful for people who want to build the darn portal lock. However, the shaman IS HIS MORTAL ENEMY! If there are more than 4 shamans in town, he will rage, and injure himself, and his special abilities are restricted.

...This class, I put alot of time into this one. Appreciate this!
On december 6, 2012
Abeo
JazsterMore suggestions..

New class...

Designer: The masticator of zombies! Superior to all, he will PWN! Actully, the designer has a 12.5% chance every day of finding a common-uncommon blueprint. Unfortunately, he has to use his mind in very unorthodox ways, so he must use all his when he thinks to try to make his own blueprint. The designer cannot build a blueprint if he's injured, infection, ghoulified, drunken, drugged, or hooked... it makes him distracted. However, when he camps, he is insipred due to the amazing world beyond . Thus, makes him have a 25% chance to make a common/uncommon blueprint, pottentialy, if he camps, and SURVIVES everyday, this effect will be permanent. However, this class has some disadvantages, if he attacks a zombie whether using his armageddon abillity, heroic uppercut, a normal weapon, he has a 33% chance of injuring himself, of course he designed good weapons, but never learned to use them. However, once he uses his thinking, he will be exhausted, will not regain from water ration/drug/food etc., but water will still relieve thirst. Also, if the designer is shunned , he cannot build blueprints. NOTE! If somehow your town is legendary, and run out of uncommon/common blueprints, the designer, will now make rare/very rare blueprints, however the chance of this is 5.5%. Also, three times per town, he may use his nagging abillity, learned from the designer school, to hault all to a specific construction for 3 days, this will be so useful for people who want to build the darn portal lock. However, the shaman IS HIS MORTAL ENEMY! If there are more than 4 shamans in town, he will rage, and injure himself, and his special abilities are restricted.

MadDonut

I...
I still...
I s-still...

ALRIGHT, THAT'S IT! I CAN'T TAKE IT ANYMORE!
Listen up, you pathetic suggestion pumping bimbos!
I'm going to add a few new rules around here!

NO overpowered items, buildings, or other objects!

NO posting stats by using rp commands!

NO making ridiculous suggestions that don't further improve the current game as it is. Even flavor text can make or break an item.

'LIKE' this thread if you enjoy the content that is provided! That's just a personal preference.

ALWAYS suggest ways an idea or ideas could be improved!

ALWAYS check back on previous items suggested to see where others failed and how to improve your own suggestions. Also, it can be an entertaining experience.

And most of all...

NO JEGGINGS!

If any of these rules are broken, you shall receive immediate silent scorn by me and possibly others. If you continue to break rules- I... Uh... hmm...... I can't really do much besides the scorning, can I?

BUT, I assure you, it will be the worst silent scorning anyone on this planet has ever gotten.

On december 6, 2012
Jazster

New Status: Depressed.

How it happens: Devastation, chaos, 10 citizens or less, town must be at day 20+.

Description: Once your town reaches devastation, your will to survive is extinct. Gone with the wind like your friends did. Seeing your friends being mercilessly eaten by the flesh-eating zombies. You wonder... why... why you are still alive. Looks like your companion choked up the last cyanide... there's almost no one left... you don't even know if anyone is actually with you. Not even the crow has the mercy to give you just 1 twinoid so you can escape the zombies. Your gates are cracked open, irreparable. You see on the forums that your technician is unable to fix it, just before he got eaten. Look's like your all alone.

What it does: Depression makes you hunger for death. Sometimes, your too lazy to make your campsite "safe". Your camping maximum % is now reduced to a risky 70%, regardless if you are a well-trained survivalist. Staying within town is suicide. Staying within 3 ap of the town is also suicide.

TEH QUESTION IS... Do you have the will to overcome depression, and just last a little bit more to get your town on the leaderboards?

Also, maybe even at 250 hero days used, you could unlock:
Heroic Motivation.
When used by a hero, this message will appear:

AH! Who gives a darn if the town is devastated, you decide to push on, hoping that you have enough confidence to ignore the never-ending zombies.

On december 6, 2012
coro

I think Depressed should just be a system of AP penalties

You start off with 2 AP, eating/drinking will give you 4 AP, eating/drinking again will give you 5 AP

Drugs give you full AP, booze gives you a chance of injury plus 1 AP (getting drunk gave you energy, but you got more depressed and hit yourself)


Not sure how one would get rid of it, but maybe talking to others (in-game PMs and town forum posts) boosts the chance that you'll feel better after a good night's sleep
On december 6, 2012
Draink

I like the Depression status effect, but can we add sad words while typing on the town forums or messages within town, but will/can this be morphed into the Terrorized status?

Edit after several posts: I agree with coro and so do my fellow ghouls.


Also, this:

TOWN IDEA:
Trading
What is trading?
Trading refers the commerce portrayed before the world collapsed into a sandy grave. It is basically a noble sacrifice occupation much like watchmen. Anyone can do it!

How does trading work?
Let's say your town is on the edge of the map, somewhere south is another underworld town/city where you may travel to if the is provided (or if my Transportation suggestion is picked up ). You may enter the town after you exit the map. Once you exit the map, there may not be a chance to communicate via town forums anymore, but now you-have access to this town's forums.

Once you enter the village, the register will say: {habitant} has found our town! What a miracle!

In the citizen's directory, it will say for example 34 residents, 2 scouts, 1 survivalist, 3 Scavengers and 1 stranger.

The stranger may not live inside the town, but may barter with the town. At the town upgrades, there will be a vote if you decide to bargain your life with a machete; in return for 5 wrought irons. If the majority succeeds, the trade is put into action. If not, you are chased out while the locals chant "raider! Raider!"

What is pillaging/raiding?
Raiding works as an option when you access the Bank inside the town. The Bank and Citizen's Directory are the only things that may be shown by the way. Once in the Bank, if you click on a object a notification will pop up saying something along the lines of this: are you sure you want to risk getting caught?

There is then a high chance of getting caught red-handed. You will not be able to exit the town, you are now a captive!

(pillaging needs more work.)

This idea may be too complex but its worth a shot or if MT can adjust this suggestion if taken

On december 6, 2012
MadDonut

*writes down the Depression suggestion on paper and puts it in his mouth*
*relaxes with a thoughtful look when suddenly there's a loud 'Ding!'*
*reaches in the back of his pants and pulls out a paper with this written on it:*

Depression Health Status
You know you've had your down moments, but now everyday feels like it's just another pointless struggle for survival. You just don't have enough energy to get anything done anymore...
Each day a town survives increases the chance for one random person to get depressed by 1%.
Each person killed, however, increases the chance for anyone to get depressed by 2.5%.
Cured the same way as Terrorized.
Decreases your maximum to 5.
You can only refill 6 by using drugs.
Watchmen: +10 ; -15
Posting while Depressed results in talks of doom.
"...it's a hopeless battle, I tell ya!..."
"...oh, what's the point...."
"...ugh... nevermind..."
"...it's no use..."
"...why should I even?..."

Ta-Da!

On december 7, 2012
MadDonut

This suggestion is SaucyemmettC's idea (as far as I know) and has been copied here for further brainstorming and edited to fit within the style of this thread.

Stain of a Killer Ghoul/Zombie Killing Mechanism
When a ghoul jumps on someone and rips them into shreds, that's gotta be pretty, well, bloody right? Limbs ripped out, bones snapped out of place, strewn from their body and then suckled on. Well how in the hell does the ghoul return to town no dirtier then someone who went out scavenging all day?
After eating a player or killing zombies, you will become Bloodstained.
If you haven't used "Cleaned Clothes" after being Bloodstained, beneath the "Spying and neighbourhood gossip" section of the House page there will be the following entry:
"is covered in blood, but that's just got to be zombie goo, right?"This new twist would add a little more to the whole "ghoul scenario"

My personal version:
Stain of a Killer Ghoul/Attacking/Zombie Killing Mechanism
When a ghoul jumps on someone and rips them into shreds, that's gotta be pretty, well, bloody right? Limbs ripped out, bones snapped out of place, strewn from their body and then suckled on. Well how in the hell does the ghoul return to town no dirtier then someone who went out scavenging all day?
After eating a player, killing a zombie, or attacking someone, you will become Bloodstained.
Using Omniscience while inside once per town, you can "Investigate Stain" which has a 25% chance of distinguishing the stain, 35% chance of guessing incorrectly and a 40% chance of failure.
"You sneak up behind (citizen) and examine their clothes...
(If ghoul): By the Crow, this blood is fresh!
(If zombie): Eh, dark and stinky. Definitely zombie.
(If failed): Suddenly, (citizen) turns around and spots you. Thinking you're there to rob them, they yell at you and kick you out of their house.
If you haven't used "Clean Clothes" after being Bloodstained, beneath the "Spying and neighbourhood gossip" section of the House page there will be the following entry:
"is covered in blood, but that's just got to be zombie goo, right?"
If you have use "Clean Clothes" after being Bloodstained, no one can "Investigate Stain", but the previous entry will be replaced with this:
"...was seen vigorously scrubbing something out of their clothes."
On december 7, 2012
Jazster

I wish I could make ideas like that, that's awesome -.-
On december 7, 2012
alwaysmetara

25% of distinguishing the stain, 35 % of guessing incorrectly...
This wouldn't do anything then

You need a way higher chance of getting it right for it to be of any use ._.'
On december 7, 2012
MadDonut
alwaysmetara

25% of distinguishing the stain, 35 % of guessing incorrectly...
This wouldn't do anything then

You need a way higher chance of getting it right for it to be of any use ._.'

That's a bit of the point. The point of it is to add in drama. Not from the mechanics itself, but from the player's side. Incorrectly guessing can lead to confusion and uncertainty.
All of this works without straight up pointing at the ghoul. There's no crosshair and trigger, there's only a stick and a rubberband.
On december 7, 2012
adameltablawy

Genius idea, sir.
But I want more urban area suggestions!
Anyway, I have a weapon idea and an action idea. Action idea meaning that it is something you can do with an item: A new use.


Molotov Cocktail
This little concoction is something from the days (and riots) of old. Getting drunk might help you forget your troubles, but fire destroys them. Permanently.

Building Equipment:
x1 Alcoholic drink (this means any one.)
x1 Wad of cash
x1 Box of Matches

Kills 5-9 zombies, 100% chance to hit.

Can be used inside town to wound a person or kill a ghoul at the cost of 2AP.

Action idea

This is something that should have been implemented a long time ago.
Peeling the meat off of a meaty bone. Costs nothing, provides you with a broken human bone and one festering flesh.
Requirements: x1 Meaty bone.
On december 7, 2012
Colette

This little concoction is something from the days (and riots) of old. Getting drunk might help you forget your troubles, but fire destroys them. Permanently.

Building Equipment:
x1 Alcoholic drink (this means any one.)
x1 Wad of cash
x1 Box of Matches

Kills 5-9 zombies, 100% chance to hit.

Can be used inside town to wound a person or kill a ghoul at the cost of 2AP.

New building idea:

Parent Building is All or nothing, you automatically get it once you build it.

Name: The Final Gambit Temporary Building

Hey, your out of materials? Really?? Well that's okay! Let's just see... carry the 4, a ha! You can bet one last time! Really, are you going to sacrifice people to do this?
-Once built, all citizens are set up to be watchmen, base defense is now 15, 50 for guardian, 35 for tamer. All citizens have a 45% chance of death. However, you know how people joined the army with their own will? NOW ITS YOUR SLAVERY THAT COUNTS! Once built, you will might escape NOT escape from the duty of watchmen! Now of course, this is a temporary building. Atleast 5% of the watchmen will survive the final gambit.

Cost of : 230
Materials: 24 wrought iron, 16 wooden planks, 18 iron supports, 14 scrap metal, 12 rotting logs, 2 nuts and bolts, 1 sheet metal, 1 car door, 2 unshaped concrete blocks, 1 twinoid, 1 anabolic steroids.

On december 8, 2012
isliceyobread
It is a real shambles here!

How about a building to rival hanging the shunned. A prison that the shunned would be stuck in but would put them to good use.

Anyone shunned would not be able to leave the town and would not be able to choose how they spend their AP, their AP would be put to use on constructions/works etc by the town.

A delegated warden would choose how their AP is spent and would also decide whether they get fed and watered or die off. They would also decide if the prisoner takes a watchmens role that night.

This building would make griefers think twice before acting the asshat by holding the account in the one town.

AP cost wise i dont think it should be too expensive but should require wrought iron metal supports and concrete.

On december 8, 2012
Jazster

I got an idea for a status.

*Paranoid/Insanity*

How to get: Be terrorized, 8.5% chance to become paranoid everyday you are terrorized.

Description: Being terrorized doesn't help... your sanity is starting to dissipate, as the ever growing hordes grow bigger, and bigger... you start to become paranoid, you always look over your back. Your starting to grow insane, so insane, that the citizens consider you a nuisance.

-When you are paranoid, you say things like this on forum.

"They're coming..."
"Ahhhh!"
"W-w-ho a-are you?"
"HEEEEEEEEEELP a zombie!!!"

-When you are paranoid, everytime you spend , you have a 25% chance to receive this message.

You slowly start to do your action... suddenly, out of nowhere, your mind goes crazy and the action is not completed, sadly looks like your went to waste.

-To heal paranoid/insanity, you must become hooked, or take a valium shot, only 2 options.

-When you are a ghoul, and have insanity/paranoid, your ghoulisim and more intense, and more noticeable! When in-town citizens have a 100% chance of seeing you eat someone, and a 75% outside!

-If your a Guardian and you have this status, your insanity limits your actions, as your bonus as a watchmen is halved, and your CP is now 3.

-If your a Survivalist and you have this status, your insanity limits your camping, since your so insane that you make your camping right beside a zombie. Your max chance of surviving a camp is now 95%.

-If your a scout, every zone you pass by, you have a 10% chance to go crazy because you have this status and lose your camoflauge!

-If your a shaman, you can't heal anyone, but you can still convert souls even with this status. (First off he can convert souls because he seems to be already partly insane in the first place)

-If your a tamer, with this status, your insanity makes your scavenging weaker, and longer, but your labrodoodle is simply just fine!

-If your a technician, with this status, your construction points is now only 75% of what it used to be, and due to your insane mind, you can't convert stuff in the workshop! How disappointing.

-*edit* If your a Scavenger, your scavenging time is 10.5% longer, and your finds 5% less great.

-*edit#2* If your a resident your max is now 5.

On december 8, 2012
Colette
isliceyofaceHow about a building to rival hanging the shunned.

No, I don't think that forcing the shunned to work is a good idea. It's better to get rid of them as quickly as possible.

I think I have suggested it already, but why not replacing the gallows with a simpler and deadlier Guillotine instead?

A Guillotine would require only a couple of patchwork beams for the frame and a crude blade made out of some wrought iron. It would not have to withstand so much stress of a prisoner struggling, so it wouldn't break and it can't be temporary. Plus, we all know that a zombie cannot live without its head, so there wouldn't be a need of dumping the corpse as it can't revive and attack you at night .
On december 8, 2012
BlackVoid

On december 9, 2012
Tiforce

Weapon Factory (Building)
Parent Building: Watchtower
Description:
It's really boring to walk around the Wolrd Beyond just to find yourself trapped in a zone with tons of your now dead neighbours and your living ones refusing to help you. Be independent, have your own weapon!
The building can be accessed the same way as the workshop and the watchtower and give the citzen a list of weapons that can be created with resources in the bank.
Only "base" wapons (Baterry Laucher 1-ITF, Water Pistol), Mobile Phone and some Melee weapons can be created.
Exemple:
Water Pistol: 2 Copper Pipe, 1 Duct Tape, 1 Stagnant Water Can.
You used the resources you had in hand to make a Water Pistol! Let's hope it won't be necessessary...

I got a new town idea!

BEHOLD!

Apocalypse Towns...

-Now you have a 5% chance to get dehydrated when thirsty .
-The zombie horde is 10% larger than normal!
-Same as hardcore, defensive objects left in the bank will be destroyed!
-When taking a drug, you now have a 12.5% chance to get hooked!
-When you are terrorised, you can't leave the town!
-Chance to injure someone in apocalypse town is even higher than hardcore!
-When you have an infection and you are a ghoul, then you have a 6.5% chance of spreading it to someone everyday.
-When you have an infection, you have a 2.5% chance of spreading it to another citizen everyday.
On december 10, 2012
L_The_Red

look Jazster, this idea wasn't so bad as the others but it still needs a lot of tweaking. i didn't get the part about getting dehydrated, do you mean that you have 5% of getting dehydrated instead of thirsty every other day?
now my idea:

New profession: Driver
The driver has a small makeshift solar powered car and it works like the tech CP, you can move 6 squares before it goes dry(the solar panels are old and on the edge so its best not to overuse them), a battery can be used to refill 2... hm... FP?(fuel points) but only once a day(again about the car components being old and on the edge of use), the hero can carry someone with him but that will make the engine work harder to carry both and so it will use 2 FP per square.

The car is light so it can be easily carried around with a small piece of rope, it also gives the hero the ability to carry 1 heavy object or 2-3 normal objects in it.

The distinction description for being a Driver should be:
Days you have spent driving around the wasteland
the idea i had is that, someone more creative (maybe a donut) should take this idea and make it better(after all my idea may be terrible(but because i made it i think it's good))

On december 10, 2012
Draink

Here

Stallion:

Can be used and act like a citizen's dehydration stats. Gains 1-2 CP for the zone.
Must be given a water ration once or once a two days to prevent dehydrated death.

Can be found in the following buildings:
Citizen's Tent
Mac's Atomic Cafe
Old Police Station

4 KM of use: Thirsty

12 KM of use: Dehydrated

15-18 KM of use: Death of the horse.

Rusted Car

To build the Rusted Car, you must first construct the basic car in the construction site for around 15-30. Once built, allows for an extra person in shotgun, and +4 inventory slots. When there is no extra person on board, you get +5!

Must be refilled after the Gas Can runs out of fuel.

One Gas Can can hold for around 14-16 KM

Can be modified in your house to have Sheet Metal added which gives an x amount of CP when outside. Base CP is 4 and 6 with Guardian.

Requires:
Engine.
x6 Twisted Planks
x6 Wrought Iron
x1 Belt
x1 gas can(new item!)

Item: Gas Can
Found in:
Wrecked Cars
Home Depot
Construction Site Shelter
Motorway Services

Rusty Bike:

Being rusty and old after all this time, it'll only go so far. Use it while you can to get where you need to go. It has no extra inventory slots.

Can ride for 5-8 KM and then turns BROKEN, can be fixed with a repair kit or kwik-fix.

Found in:
Looted Supermarket
Burnt School
Old Bicycle Hire Shop
Town Library
Home Depot
Wrecked Transporter

Goat/Donkey (suggested by HyperDemon)

2KM of use: Thirsty

6KM of use: Dehydrated

9-7KM of use: Death.

(suggested by Griffon)
What about a random chance of a break-down? Maybe a system where the further you drive, the more of a chance you have of your vehicle malfunctioning?

For instance, you drive 10 KM and the following message is displayed, similar to how a message is displayed when you break a weapon:

As you drive along the barren wasteland, and you hear a loud pop and banging sound. Your car, if it is safe to call it that, has rolls to a halt, and cannot restart the duck-taped engine! Looks like you may be camping tonight...

Note: This is targeted to vehicular means of transportation.

New profession: Driver
The driver has a small makeshift solar powered car and it works like the tech CP, you can move 6 squares before it goes dry(the solar panels are old and on the edge so its best not to overuse them), a battery can be used to refill 2... hm... FP?(fuel points) but only once a day(again about the car components being old and on the edge of use), the hero can carry someone with him but that will make the engine work harder to carry both and so it will use 2 FP per square.

On december 11, 2012
Jazster

New Profession: Soldier

The soldier, being an expert in war, has no problem being in the apocalypse!

Special Abilities...

-Fix Wound: Uses 5 , gives soldier fixed status. Next day the soldier has a 50% chance to get an infection, due to his mediocre fixing. At least he's not wounded...

-Knockback Attack: Uses 6, soldier attacks 1-2 zombies, killing them! This can only be used once per day! The soldier also has a 33% chance to wound himself however.

-Army Experience: Since the soldier is experienced with attacking other people, since they were smart, zombies, no problem! When putting this abillity on, the soldier can supply an extra 60 to the watchmen, but he has a 15% chance to die, and a 30% chance of wounding... are you willing to take a chance?

.......................................

The soldier can also attack a person for only 3, and has a higher chance to injure someone, but has also a chance to injure himself.

-However, being in the army, and retiring, and litteraly being in the front lines, every day he has a 1% chance to become terrorised.

-Terrorism actually helps him! The soldier can overcome terrorism, and now his knock back ability is more aggressive! How does this work? Well, the soldier is overconfident, so he don't care about being terrorized, also terrorized rules don't affect him if he's in a zone with zombies!

-Also, being an expert with weapons, he has a bonus 7.5% chance to not make the weapon break, or run out of ammo!

This message will appear when you save ammo.

Yes! You figure out how to reload the weapon, and improve the battery, looks like you can use this again.

Summary:

The soldier is a resourceful man with a lot of experience in attacking other things or people. He's an expert at weapons, and can overcome terrorism! He also special techniques to attack, for a lower ap cost, so, he's pretty much a class that is an expert in offensiveness!
On december 11, 2012

New Profession: Soldier

The soldier, being an expert in war, has no problem being in the apocalypse!

Special Abilities...

-Fix Wound: Uses 5 , gives soldier fixed status. Next day the soldier has a 50% chance to get an infection, due to his mediocre fixing. At least he's not wounded...

-Knockback Attack: Uses 6, soldier attacks 1-2 zombies, killing them! This can only be used once per day! The soldier also has a 33% chance to wound himself however.

-Army Experience: Since the soldier is experienced with attacking other people, since they were smart, zombies, no problem! When putting this abillity on, the soldier can supply an extra 60 to the watchmen, but he has a 15% chance to die, and a 30% chance of wounding... are you willing to take a chance?

.......................................

The soldier can also attack a person for only 3, and has a higher chance to injure someone, but has also a chance to injure himself.

-However, being in the army, and retiring, and litteraly being in the front lines, every day he has a 1% chance to become terrorised.

-Terrorism actually helps him! The soldier can overcome terrorism, and now his knock back ability is more aggressive! How does this work? Well, the soldier is overconfident, so he don't care about being terrorized, also terrorized rules don't affect him if he's in a zone with zombies!

-Also, being an expert with weapons, he has a bonus 7.5% chance to not make the weapon break, or run out of ammo!

This message will appear when you save ammo.



Summary:

The soldier is a resourceful man with a lot of experience in attacking other things or people. He's an expert at weapons, and can overcome terrorism! He also special techniques to attack, for a lower ap cost, so, he's pretty much a class that is an expert in offensiveness!

Good on some parts bad on others, the soldier needs an undroppable item, the amount of ap needed for the knock-back attack is too high, and the extra 60 points for watchmen is also too high.

Also, that terrorized chance should turn into something like traumatizing, where the soldier has random hallucinations and may attack a fellow player in the WB, thinking they are the enemy. From what I see in movies and shows, it is common for soldier to act like this (though I'm not so sure about the attacking allies part).
On december 11, 2012
dDShockTroop

Really, I think all these hero classes are convoluted and would be quite happy if they had a class that had no special powers past the generic hero abilities, but awarded 1 free hero day for every 2 played as it. Of course, it's not going to happen, because that wouldn't encourage spending so...

Superhero mode!
Whenever you have gained hero days you may decide to upgrade to superhero mode, which consumes 2 hero days for every 1 day played. Additionally, for the purposes of long-term hero bonuses, each day counts double to account for the increased cost, and you gain distinctions for both classes (or 2 distinctions for the same class, if a double class is chosen). As a superhero, you may select 2 classes (which can be the same if desired). You get the bonuses (and profession tool with additional space to hold it, unless you're a double class) for both of your classes. Additionally, you may perform 2 heroic actions each day, and have a limit of 2 of each action per life. House upgrades remain unchanged, however you start with 4 base home defence, not 2. Long term bonuses (such as clean body) are unchanged, though they can be acquired twice as quickly due to the double hero day consumption.

Here are the double classes obtained by picking the same job twice. This list only specifies the differences between the regular class and double classes, all other features are the same.

Super Scavenger (Large shovel):
-Autosearch takes only 1 hour.
-Always finds something in non-depleted zones
-Double oxygen bonus in ruins. (Total of 200%)

Super Scout (Desert Camo):
-Scout sense returns exact zombie number.
-Can detect buildings in adjacent zones. (Marked with a little house on the arrow next to the zombie number)
-Chance of being detected is halved
-Can search a zone or building without breaking camo.
-Camping penalty for zombies in zone further reduced if came is active.

Super Guardian (Riot Gear):
-Provides +10 defence instead of 5 to town. Counts as 2 guardians for purposes of guard tower.
-Has a +50 defence bonus (instead of +30) as a watchman, and has +10 to survival. (Instead of +5)
-Has an extra 2 CP on top of the guardian's bonus.
-Gains an additional defence point in their home.

Super Tamer (4-legged Labradoodle):
-Does not require steroids for heavy objects.
-Can be used a second time each day, but can only bring back 3 light objects. (Will display an error message that the dog is too tired and needs a lighter load if there are too many objects in your inventory.)
-Gives an extra 10 watchmen attack points on top of the tamer's 20.

Super Technician (Technician's Toolbelt):
-Has 12CP instead of 6.
-Can spend 1 AP to convert a blank into a key anywhere by using a "build" action when it's in his rucksack.

Super Survivalist (Great Book of Wasteland Survival):
-The book can be used twice each day, either to eat and drink, or to try again if the first failed.
-Using the survival guide for food gives Premium food bonus.
-As a ghoul, the water option for survival guide is replaced with human flesh, and restores 2 days worth of ghoul hunger, but gives no AP.
-The survival guide can be used to look for hallucinogenic mushrooms, which simply gives the drugged status (or hooked, if already drugged) and removes terrorized. This gives no AP.
-The guide can also be used to make a makeshift bandage using long grass and other plants. This heals a wound at the cost of an infection (and the healed status).

Super Shaman (Ritual Mask):
-Rain dance gives 10 rations to well, or destroys 6-12 zombies in the zone. It no longer has a chance of failing.
-Can locate lost souls in unexplored zones with up to 1km inaccuracy by checking the map.
-With healing hands the affliction can be selected. However, the list to select from contains all possible afflictions, not just what they have, and selecting a wrong affliction with result in a failure message, loss of the AP, and prevents a second use of the ability on that citizen.
-Healing hands failure chance is halved, and a failed result will never transfer the affliction to you.
On december 11, 2012
Jazster

New Profession: Soldier (VERSION 1.1)

The soldier, being an expert in war, has no problem being in the apocalypse!

Special Abilities...

-Fix Wound: Uses 5 , gives soldier fixed status. Next day the soldier has a 50% chance to get an infection, due to his mediocre fixing. At least he's not wounded...

-Knock back Attack: Uses 4, soldier attacks 2-4 zombies, killing them! This can only be used once per day! The soldier also has a 55% chance to wound himself however.

-Army Experience: Since the soldier is experienced with attacking other people, since they were smart, zombies, no problem! When putting this ability on, the soldier can supply an extra 35 to the watchmen, but he has a 10% chance to die, and a 25% chance of wounding... are you willing to take a chance?

.......................................

The soldier can also attack a person for only 3, and has a higher chance to injure someone, but has also a chance to injure himself.

-However, being in the army, and retiring, and literally being in the front lines, every day he has a 1% chance to become terrorised.

-Terrorism actually helps him! The soldier can overcome terrorism, and now his knock back ability is more aggressive! How does this work? Well, the soldier is overconfident, so he don't care about being terrorized, also terrorized rules don't affect him if he's in a zone with zombies! HOWEVER: The soldier when terrorized, gets replaced with a traumatized status. This will not make him be trapped in a zone with 1 zombie etc, but everyday, if the soldier is in town, the bad memories come back, and has a 15% chance to injure someone everyday.

-Also, being an expert with weapons, he has a bonus 7.5% chance to not make the weapon break, or run out of ammo!

This message will appear when you save ammo.

Undroppable Item: Army suit... this was your suit, you wore it in the army, now it's time to wear it in the apocalypse/ This suit brings back confidence and memories... without this, you wouldn't have enough bravery to knock back zombies!



Summary:

The soldier is a resourceful man with a lot of experience in attacking other things or people. He's an expert at weapons, and can overcome terrorism! He also special techniques to attack, for a lower ap cost, so, he's pretty much a class that is an expert in offensiveness!
On december 11, 2012
dDShockTroop

Multiple towns per player. The ability to join more than one town at any given time. Available for heroes only (perhaps as a long-term reward?) Hero days still count down at the same rate (1 per day). A hero can only be in 1 hardcore town, up to 3 distant towns, and any number of private or small towns as they desire at any given time. Each additional town requires the hero to have 10 hero days remaining. A hero may only join 1 town per day, and must have at least 10 hero days in reserve for every additional town joined. (These are not consumed) So if a hero wants to join 7 towns, they need 60 hero days in reserve, likewise 3 towns only requires 20 reserve hero days.
On december 11, 2012
Kowasaci1

I made a better thing with the solider.

RIFLEMANThe rifleman was one of the brave that fought the dead before society collapsed....And they still live,respected by everyone.

The rifleman has 5 bullets that are a insta-kill.However after the gun is empty he can't shoot anymore,in order to regain his ammo he must wait another day.

However they have 1 less CP.

If a player is in the zone and the rifleman shoots there is a chanche:90% that the zombie will die normally.9% that the player will get wounded,but the zed will still die.1% that the player will die with the zed.

He has 25 Def on watch and 95% survival chanche.

OPTIONAL: Due to his reputation he needs a extra complaint to get shunned!
On december 11, 2012
Anglophone

Why would you need 10 hero days in advance?
On december 12, 2012
dDShockTroop

So someone doesn't join 50 towns with very few hero days left and expire to resident. There's probably a better way of doing that, but that's what sprung to mind. And so there is a feasible upper limit to how many towns someone can join so they don't overdo it and dehydrate all over the shop.

Oh, and it encourages people to make long term investments into the game. I image MT likes that.
On december 12, 2012
alwaysmetara

If you seriously want to join multiple towns, learn a new language and try one of the other language versions ._.'
I imagine that multiple towns have been suggested before but was declined (or something).
Well, if you're in a really active town you can burn through hours doing stuff on the irc

On december 17, 2012
dDShockTroop

On december 19, 2012
ImbuedGreen

New Hero Unlock

The ability to sticky a thread in a town-forum.

Obviously you would have some sort of limit on the number of threads that can be stickied per town.. Maybe up to 5. Maybe just 1.

A few ideas to prevent overuse/abuse:

Unlocks somewhere in between the end of current hero unlocks (Pro-Camper --- Architect )
Have some sort of voting-system
Require a specific length of the original post
Require a certain number of posts before the thread can be stickied
The author of the thread can accept/deny another hero's request to sticky the thread

Don't look at this suggestion as if you have to say yes or no, like or dislike. It's an idea. As should be done for all suggestions, look at the concept of the suggestion, and offer input/adjustments/additions/whatever accordingly. Look at the general idea, not any specific part or restriction.
I think this would be helpful for those threads that are frequently used.. whether it be informational references, or a thread of strategic debate. Explorable ruin? End-game camping? Gates/gatekeeping? (perhaps this last one should be a default sticky... )

Regardless, it would be immensely helpful, for both meta and random towns.
On december 19, 2012
MadDonut

Continue with the excellent discounts you have been giving.

Easter Eggs. I could make some right here, but then they wouldn't be really be hidden things anymore.

Anglophone

I really agree with ImbuedGreen's idea. It would also be fairly easy for MT to implement.
On december 20, 2012
adameltablawy

A random, stupid idea that I suddenly felt the urge to propose.

Human Catapult

Provides: 80 .

Costs: 1 Wrought Iron. 30 AP

Well. You really scraped the bottom of the ideal barrel here, didn't you?
The idea is this: One Citizen per day can volunteer themselves to be shot from this catapault into the world beyond at any square that was explored in the previous day or that day.
Of course, the citizen will splatter into a bloody pulp on that square. The bright side is that the zombies will be distracted during the attack and go to feast on the gory remains.
This is such a pointless and suicidal event that it provides an achievement for all citizens involved in building the construction and who launch themselves.

A five percent chance exists that the citizen WILL touch down safely, which provides ANOTHER distinction.

All items are left behind in their chest after they launch themselves, preventing them from flinging themselves into space with a hacksaw.

It costs the same amount of AP to launch yourself as it does an item.

Distinctions:

For launching yourself:
x5 Heroic Sacrifice
x10 Death wish
x20 I believe I can fly
x50 Too dumb to live
x100 Apollo 13

For touching down safely

x1 Improbable odds
x10 Extreme daredevil
x15 Luckier than a Leprechaun
x50 Eat your heart out, gravity!

Stupid idea? Yes. But still, the hilarity of it will make it worth it. And with so much defense, it's essentially the same as volunteering to be meat lockered, but with a Unique distinction.

On december 20, 2012
MadDonut

Hilarious idea?
Why that reminds me of my own wondrous classic:

WARNING:
Mild, Uninteresting Profanity. a.k.a Poop Joke.
Don't read if feces offends you.

Pile of Shit Uncommon Blueprint
Come forth thy might foe and best ye pile of feces!
Adds 10 Defense every time someone uses it.
Costs 1 AP to crap a big one.
After squishing your face 15 minutes, you have managed to relieve yourself of 10 to the town!
Must have eaten to shit.

Requires: 75 AP

On december 21, 2012
Jazster

New Building ...
Call To Arms

Temporary Building
5
(From Emergency Supplies)
Needs 25 to build.
Needs: x1 electronic component, x1 battery launcher (loaded), x1 semtex , x4 wooden planks, and x10 wrought iron.

In addition to its temporary defense, watchmen will have a bonus 5 base defense, and their weapons will be 10% more effective.
....................................

1 more suggestion...
New status: ANGER!
-Every day your shunned, you have a 37.5% chance to get this status.
-Every day you haven`t eaten, you have a 1.5% chance to get this status.
-When you are dehydrated, you have a 12.5% chance to get this status.
-Every day your wounded, you have a 50% chance to get this status

What it does:

DISADVANTAGES:

-You can`t focus because your so angry, so you can`t discover blueprints for the town.
-You have a higher chance of injuring someone, and your self.
-You can`t use the workshop
-You can`t use the watchtower
-You can`t build higher levels of shelters.
-Your scavenging is horrible!
ADVANTAGES:

-When your a watchmen, you get +10 because your raging and you litteraly beat up zombies!
-When you attack a zombie with your fist, you have a higher chance of killing them!

HOW TO HEAL:
By siesta(hero), or anything that can cure terrorised.
On december 22, 2012
MadDonut

Call to Arms sounds awefully like the Miniature Armory and Swedish Workshop...

Anger doesn't fit in well and makes no sense at all. Like, why exactly would you get that freaking angry by being wounded, hungry, or thirsty?

"Do, do, doo... Hmm, I'm feeling a bit peckish/thirsty... Oh wait! NO!
RRRRAAAAAAAAAGH! HULK SMASH!"

"Ow! I stubbed my toe on this damn stump..
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARGH! I WILL KILL YOU ALL FOR THIS!"

Someone needs anger management classes...

it's a home improvement(hero only, obviously)that works like the veggie plot but only gives one crop(90% of the time a weird looking vegetable(i'm too lazy to check if that's the actual name)), when built the home page will have the option "harvest crop", i'm not sure of what should be needed to build it but i guess it would need 1 or 2 chemical products and something else(maybe a twisted plank)
On december 22, 2012
Jazster

Hmm... I guess your right, and I think it could be good if it would be linked to paranoid status few posts back.

Anyway, I got another suggestion, hope you like it..

Specialty Buildings!
*A town can only have 1 of these kinds of buildings, so your 20 guardians and your 20 tamers may have to flip a coin...*

(Will start a new type of construction and all unlocked when town starts)

Lil' Campin' School!
Needs 150, provides 0, needs x4 wrought iron, x18 wooden planks, x1 sheet metal, x1 nuts and bolts. Every citizen regardless if survivalist or not can use 3 to use the school once per day, and the may find a better survival chance, and deduction of hardcore etc., is reduced! (MUST HAVE ATLEAST 1 SURVIVALIST TO TEACH THE STUDENTS! )

Scouting Range
Needs 100, provides 5, needs x12 wrought iron, x12 wooden planks, x1 electronic component, x1 twinoid. The scout can now scout the tower 2 times a day, and provides much more accurate readings! (MUST HAVE ATLEAST 1 SCOUT)

UBER Workshop
Needs 150, provides 0. needs x2 sheet metal, x15 wooden planks, x12 wooden supports, x 4 wrought iron. The amazing technican can now transform stuff in the workshop for a mesely 1 or 1cp. However, the hacksaw, or factory will not effect this bonus... (MUST HAVE ATLEAST 1 TECHNICAN)

Shaman's Den
Needs 150, provides 5. needs x3 sheet metal, x1 blue soul, x1 red soul, x10 wooden planks, x12 wrought iron. The epic shaman now has a 90% chance of healing people without hurting himself or failing!

The Vet
Needs 100, provides 0. Needs x1 sheet metal, x1 old door, x28 wooden planks. Now, the tamer's labradoodle can now carry a heavy object everyday, providing the tamer goes to the vet everyday by spending 3. (MUST HAVE ATLEAST 1 TAMER)

Guardian's Fort
Needs 150, provides 35. Needs x4 sheet metal, x2 nuts and bolts, x1 electronic component, x1 old door, x14 wooden planks, x10 wrought iron, x3 battery launchers (loaded), x1 semtex. Makes the guardians STRONGER! In edition to their massive defensive bonus as watchmen, the guardian makes 25% of the watchmen have 100% survival rates, and provides an extra 10! (MUST HAVE ATLEAST 1 GUARDIAN)

Search Force
Needs 150, provides 0, needs x1 twinoid, x1 anabolic steroids, x1 vodka, x1 water, x1 unlabled drug, x12 wrought iron, x1 old door, x12 wooden planks, x1 . Now, the scavengers have even more oxygen in ruins, svavenging is 25% faster, and can search 3-6 times before auto-searching! (MUST ALTEAST HAVE 1 SCAVENGER)
On december 22, 2012
MadDonut

Some more ideas.
Now presented in fancy borders!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Rusty Two-Handed Axe Weapon
Feel free to yell, "Timber!" when you're chopping undead heads off.
100% chance to kill one zombie. 55% chance to kill two zombies.
20% chance to break.
+10 , 0
Found at Citizen's Tent, Dark Woods, Garden Shed, Home Depot, and Old Police Station.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Derailed Freight Train Ruin
Only one could image the awe and terror of the scene as the train skidded and flipped off the tracks. Most of the cars are twisted and bent with each other, but there might be a few items still salvageable in the surviving cargo.
Camping level 2.
Here you can find a Handful of Nuts and Bolts, Belt, Mechanism, Adjustable Spanner, Rusty Chain, Construction Kit (3), Chest, Toolbox, Citizen's Welcome Pack, Parcel, Solid Wooden Board, Food Parcel, Boxes, Engine (incomplete), and Flatpacked Furniture.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Moldy Christmas Sweater Misc. Item
You're not sure if it looked better before or after it became moldy and rotten.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Old Rubber Wheel (punctured) Heavy Misc. Item
From tire swings to rolling down hills, this simplistic device provides hours of amusement. It's thick rubber hide also is a good zombie tooth-proof material. Unfortunately, this one's got a hole in it...
Combine Old Rubber Wheel (punctured) and Duct Tape to create an Old Rubber Wheel.
Found at Ambulance, Blocked Road, Disused Car Park, Old Aerodrome, Wrecked Cars, Wrecked Transporter.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Old Rubber Wheel Misc. Item
From tire swings to rolling down hills, this simplistic device provides hours of amusement. It's thick rubber hide is also a good zombie tooth-proof material.
Is no longer a Heavy item since it rolls.
+0 , +5
Distracts (kills) one zombie, but doesn't return.
"The Old Rubber Wheel rolls towards the undead foe and thumps into it's leg. Annoyed, the beast topples onto the tire and begins fiendishly trying to tear into it. Yep, that's going to take awhile pal. On the plus side, that's one less zombie to worry about now he's distracted"
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
On december 23, 2012
adameltablawy

Ruined book

An old, worn book, torn by the sands of time. You can vaguely make out some words on it...it seems to have something to do with vampires.

A ridiculous parody of the overly popular Twilight series.

Distracts two zombies. Text:
You hurl the book at the zombies, and it smacks into one of their foreheads. The zombie bends down, and picks up the book. After fumbling with the pages for a bit, to your astonishment, it begins to read. Soon enough, a few more of the monsters are now completely engrossed in the book.

You have bought yourself some time to run!

The zombies are distracted for two minutes, turning zombie control points to zero, reminiscent of the grisly bomb.

Found in:
Warehouse
Town Library
Small house
Smuggler's Cache
Post Office
Scottish Smith's Superstore
Plane Crash site
Once Inhabited Cave
Old Field Hospital
Looted Supermarket
Duke's Villa
Dilapidated Building
Abandoned Hospital
Abandoned Hotel
Citizen's Home
Indian Burial Ground (wait, what?)
Normal, non-depleted zones (Scavenger's only)

5+ Decoration points.

MadDonut

Yay, More ideas!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
(This idea was originally thought up by Tiforce)
Advanced Workshop Rare Blueprint
By stripping apart weapons and seeing how they tick, you can recreate a few of your own DIY versions with a bit of spit, grit, and a whole lot of Duct Tape.
Despite the ending words, some weapon blueprints do not actually require Duct Tape.
Once built, the Workshop gains a weapon subsection that at first is empty and you gain an "Examine (weapon)" action on your House page. When you "Examine (weapon)", the item is destroyed and a new blueprint appears to the weapon subsection.
"You carefully lay the item down on a small table and begin to deconstruct the (weapon). After staring intently at the arranged pieces before you, you learn how to build your very own! Sadly, the original weapon has been too scienced on to for any future use..."
Originally requires 5 to craft a weapon, but will decrease if you use a Hacksaw or your town has built the Factory just like the normal Workshop. Technicians can use their construction points here as well (may change if this makes the Technician too overpowered).

Requires: 4 Metal Support, 10 Wooden Beam, 3 Handful of Nuts and Bolts, and a J√§rpen Table. Workshop must be built.

Weapon Blueprints:
(All ammo consuming weapons are created empty)
Battery Launcher 1-ITF = 1 Wrought Iron, 1 Copper Pipe, 1 Duct Tape, 1 Electronic Component.
Water Pistol = 1 Wrought Iron, 1 Copper Pipe, 1 Duct Tape, 1 Plastic Bag.
Rusty Chain = 3 Scrap Metal, 1 Handful of Nuts and Bolts.
Handful of Bullets = 3 Wrought Iron, 1 Flash Powder.
Mobile Phone = 1 Twisted Plank, 1 Electronic Component, 1 Compact Detonator, 1 Battery.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Battered Baseball Bat Weapon item
This sandy slugger will guarantee you a at least one homerun, but it's wooden figure is close to striking out..
100% chance to kill 1 zombie.
35% chance to break.
+ 3 | +0
Found at normal scavenging zones, Abandoned Park, Burnt School, and Fairground Stall.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Somehow this can of pop is still bubbly after who knows how long in the desert. Oh well, cheers!
100% to give at least 6 AP.
50% to give 7 AP.
Gives 'Refreshed' status effect.
Also gives status effect 'Bubbly!'

(A player with the 'Bubbly' effect will have random burps and belches effects mixed in with their forum and private messages. So the message "Hey, what's up mate?" might turn into "Hey, *burp* What's up, 'scuse me, mate?")

On december 31, 2012
MadDonut

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Claw Hammer Weapon Item
Stop, hammer time!
25% chance to kill one zombie.
30% chance to break.
+1 | +0
Opens Can, Food Parcel, Chest, Large Chest, and Toolbox.
Usually used with Box of Rusty Nails to create other items.
Found at normal scavenging zone, Abandoned Construction Site, Construction Site Shelter, Garden Shed, Home Depot, and PI-KEYA Furniture.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Box of Rusty Nails (BRN) Scarce Resource Item
Nail in your defenses with these handy little spikes. Be careful when you are hammering though, apocalypses are no fun with tetanus.
Required for some buildings.
Wooden Fencing = 1x BRN
Small Fence = Replace 2x N&B with 2x BRN.
Railgun = 1x N&B and 1X BRN
Coffin Catapult = 3 N&B and 2x BRN
Wood Plating = 1x BRN
False Town = 12x N&B and 3x BRN
Combine BRN and Claw Hammer with Twisted Plank to created Nailed Plank.
Combine BRN and Claw Hammer with Battered Baseball Bat to create Nail Bat.
Created by converting Scrap Metal at the Workshop.
Found at Abandoned Construction Site, Construction Site Shelter, Home Depot, PI-KEYA Furniture, and Small house.
(Not found in Normal Scavenging Zones to make it slighter harder to find)
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Nail Bat Weapon Item
With the power of a blunt bat and the stab damage of a rake, it's time to bash in some undead heads.
100% chance to kill two zombies.
33% chance to break.
+5 | +0
Made by combining a Battered Bat with a Box of Rusty Nails and Claw Hammer.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Nailed Plank Weapon Item
A nice, extra big cluster of nails on a wooden board turns a hammering mishap into a brain penetration device.
33% chance to kill one zombie
73% chance to break.
+0 | +0
(Would be too easy for metas to mass produce for easy Watchmen defense)
Made by combining a Battered Bat with a Box of Rusty Nails and Claw Hammer.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Battery Powered Nail Gun (incomplete) (BPNG) Weapon Item
It might be cheap and deadly to fire little rusty spikes into undead flesh, but it's not very reliable..
Especially since this one seems to be missing a few parts.
Combine BPNG (incomplete), Twisted Plank, N&B, and Duct Tape to create Battery Powered Nail Gun (uncharged/empty)
Found at Found at normal scavenging zones, Abandoned Construction Site, Construction Site Shelter, Home Depot, and PI-KEYA Furniture.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Battery Powered Nail Gun (charged/4 shots) Weapon
It might be cheap and deadly to fire little rusty spikes into undead flesh, but it's not very reliable..
55% chance to kill one zombie each shot.
Takes away a shot each use.
Turns into a Battery Powered Nail Gun (uncharged/empty) after all three shots are up.
Made by combining a Battery Powered Nail Gun (uncharged/empty) with a Battery and then combining the Battery Powered Nail Fun (charged/empty) with a Box of Rusty Nails.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

MadDonut

*raises hand and looks like he's preparing to slap ArcenMan*

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Burning Rubble Weapon Item
A bundle of dead twigs and discarded trash that have been set ablaze most likely from lightning from one of the nightly storms.
70% chance to kill one zombie.
Breaks and turns into Unrecognizable Remains after use or the attack.
+7 | +0
Able to roast Dried Marshmallows.
Found by finding it as a lucky item when you "Search the refuse".
Found at Depleted zones, Abandoned Park, Burnt School, Dark Woods, and Plane Crash Site.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
On january 1, 2013
MadDonut

These two ideas were originated by ArcenMan here and Colette here.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Incendiary Pigs Rare Blueprint
If Alexander the Great's secret weapon of flaming boars work against elephants, it should work well against the horde. Cover your ears though, they make a real ratchet when they're burning alive.
+70 defense.

Requires: 45 , 3x Stinking Pig, 1x Gas Can, and 1x Box of Matches. Emergency Supplies must be built.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Explosive Kami-Crazies Rare Blueprint
As a final message of hate, you can strap explosives with dead man switches to the undesirables and let them loose into the horde. Be warned though, in the frenzy of things, they tend to get disoriented and might head back towards the town...
Hardcore towns only.
+30 defense per shunned.
Heavily damages buildings.

Requires: 100 , 3x Duct Tape, 3x Semtex, and 3x Compact Detonator.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Cheap Alarm Clock (uncharged) Rare Misc. Item
These little battery powered gadgets were to be recalled because they short circuited and catch fire each time the hammer slams into the battery, but then the apocalypse happened.
Works like the Screaming Alarm Clock (ready), but works for one night only and requires a battery to be used. Once used, it disappears forever the following morning.
Found at Abandoned Bunker, Abandoned Hotel, Duke's Villa, and Motel 666 Dusk.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
On january 1, 2013
MadDonut

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Game-O-Tron 3000 (incomplete) Misc. Item
There's still a game cartridge lodged into the slot that looks like it's something about an electrician jumping on beavers. Seems like it might entertain you for awhile (Requires 1 Battery)
Combine a Game-O-Tron 3000 (incomplete) with a Battery to make a Game-O-Tron 3000 (charged).
Cures Terrorized health status when charged. Uses Battery on use.
"After jumping on various aquatic lifeforms, you reach the final boss which is a giant platypus. You quickly smash the buttons to preform your combo attack when suddenly the Battery dies. Well, at least you got some of the recent events out of your mind for awhile and satisified your hatred for those dam beavers."
Found at normal scavenging zones, Abandoned Park, Burnt School, Fairground Stall, and Wrecked Cars.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
On january 8, 2013
Draink

Jumping the Gate! (action)
Pros:

Gives option to jump the Gates when at 0,0 for a chance to live another day in the wasteland.

May be used to attempt to prevent last-minute deaths.

Helps against the Portal Lock

Cons:
25% to become wounded and not cross the gates.
25% to climb over it but become wounded.
Chances for becoming wounded are increased by a 5-10% when Drunk.

Option: Jump the Gates? (2-4 cost)

This is a previous idea I made right before the Twinoid immigration, very similar to the original.

Potentially scavengable items:
Metal Support

First comes in broken form, needs to be fixed via N&Bs and Duct Tape or EC, not sure still!
When fixed, allows crushed batteries to be recombined into usable batteries. One Reclaimer will use four crushed batteries and make one new battery, Two (when in inventory) will allow three crushed to make one new, and three (lol this ain't happening) will make two for one. Now you're walking battery facility! Go shoot 'em up. (:

On january 15, 2013
EdgyVenison

Suggestion:
Limiting the number of coalesced citizens in a town to less than 40 would be really nice.

TBH, I am really starting to hate meta jumps; they ruin towns with decent survival chance by performing mass suicides to attend the meta jumps. Mass suicides really ruins non-meta towns, and the only reason I see why peoples do this mass suicides is to attend meta jumps.
Telling that you would perform a suicide in a specified date to the town forum does not help. At all.

Limiting the number of coalesced citizens would be a one way to prevent or reduce the occurrence this problem. Any other way to reduce these 'mass suicides' would be nice.

I have an idea for boosting scavenger ability

I will start what each classes mainly have

Class -> main ability -> sum up

survivalist -> 100% camping -> camper ,NEED
scout -> mini watch tower , all for searching buildlding explorer ,NEED A FEW
guardian -> they are truly defenders of the town now -> town defense points ,NEED
shaman -> soul manager + healer -> bad ass back up NEED ONE
technician -> ruin unlocker -> ruin BP collector NEED ONE
tamer -> collector -> flexible zone controller + gatherer NEED A FEW

scavenger -> currently, they can deplete 2 zone/day while other classes can do about 1 zone/day

This class can be ignored because they just scavenge faster but at last accessible areas will be depleted or the town will have enough resources because everyone scavenges

Because no one can maximum depleting zone all time, I have an idea to fix this.

Scavenger can find something more than log and scrap at depleted zones!

This makes scanveger to be search tower itself.

And ever if town are surronded, areas near the town are depleted, there are still scavengers keeping scavenge new things for the town!

On january 16, 2013
Anglophone

If the meta cap is reinstated, this game will collapse. The only reason why you see the occasional season update is due to the fact that it is profitable. Without the heroes who play in metas, that money would dry up.

It was disastrous the first time.

The only time random towns are truly ruined by jumps is in the event of a failed jump, which results in >50% of the town being occupied by the meta. Otherwise, losing a few members in a random town is not that big of a deal - random towns have mass deaths due to stupidity of players anyway.

These deaths do much more to ruin random towns than the occasional town aborted by a failed jump.

If this is happening to you on a frequent basis, then you probably shouldn't jump into newly opened towns with very few people in them or tonws with an inordinate amount of coalesced citizens. You're much less likely to mess up someone's jump this way.

On january 25, 2013
MadDonut

Idea fueled by IRen's comment here.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Gyrocopter (full tank) Heavy Misc item
Hover over the dunes and wastes with this amazing light weight contraption! Running with the same engine as your ordinary prewar car, this miniature helicopter can spend up to twenty minutes in the air for each gallon used (but accidents are bound to happen with this rickety device).
Combine a Gyrocopter Frame, 4 Handful of Nuts and Bolts, 2 Sheet Metal, Engine, and an Electrical Component to make Gyrocopter (empty tank).
Uses a Gas Can. Once outside, there will be a countdown from '20 minutes' until you return to town. To increase the timer, refill the tank again.
It carries only one person, the pilot, and allows for one item to be carried with you that is not heavy.
8% to crash land, thus injuring the pilot and destroying the Gyrocopter, each time you move to a new zone. Automatically crash lands if you do not return to town in time. -3% chance to crash if you're a Technician.
"Suddenly, a loud explosion goes off right behind you. The Gyrocopter begins smoking heavily and the ground seems to come right at you really, really, really fa-"
(text pauses and you must click [Continue])
(now you appear as injured) "You spits sand out of your mouth as you sorely rub your (bodypart). You climb out of the smoking wreckage that was your Gyrocopter, amazed you're still alive."
You can "Attempt an Emergency Landing" when there is less than three minutes left on the gas tank. The Gyrocopter is destroyed in the proccess, but you wont be injured this way.
"You dive down and attempt to land. You realize that sandy dunes and rocks don't make for a very good runway as the Gyrocopter flips. Luckily, you come out unscathed, unlike the now destroyed Gyrocopter..."

Sidenotes: A Gyrocopter Frame is a heavy item and will display what it already has been put in it by hovering over it's icon.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

On january 27, 2013
Colette

With all the recent suggestions of vehicles, I imagined a way of implementing a vehicle (or a wheeled machine, for that matter) without necessarily using it for crossing the desert, which is quite annoying.

Bulldozer
Blueprint: Rare or Very Rare

Description:
Still relying on animal power to build? Give your neighbors a break and use high-powered machinery instead! Though this motorized cart is far from being high-powered, carrying construction materials and clearing the debris on your construction sites with it will definitely help reduce the load on your neighbors' backs.

Effect: Reduces the cost of all constructions by 25% (15% in HC towns)

Constructed with:
100
Shopping Trolley
Engine
Wrought Iron x 20
Handful of nuts & bolts x3
Battery x5
Copper Pipe x3
On january 27, 2013
Draink

Stallion:

Can be used and act like a citizen's dehydration stats. Gains 1-2 CP for the zone.
Must be given a water ration once or once a two days to prevent dehydrated death.

Can be found in the following buildings:
Citizen's Tent
Mac's Atomic Cafe
Old Police Station

4 KM of use: Thirsty

8 KM of use: Dehydrated

12 KM of use: Death of the horse.

+10|+2
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Rusted Car

To build the Rusted Car, you must first construct the basic car in the construction site for around 15-30. Once built, allows for an extra person in shotgun, and +4 inventory slots. When there is no extra person on board, you get +5!
Can be modified in your house to have Sheet Metal added which gives an x amount of CP when outside. Base CP is 4 and 6 with Guardian.
After 5KM, there is a 50% per every zone after of breaking down. Camping with the Rusted Car ends up breaking it.

Requires:
Engine.
x6 Twisted Planks
x6 Wrought Iron
x1 Belt
x1 Gas Can


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
(incomplete)Mountain Bike:
To fix the bike, it requires 1 roll of Duct Tape.

Being rusty and old after all this time, it'll only go so far. Use it while you can to get where you need to go. It has no extra inventory slots.

Works like the Rusted Car, but every KM after 0,0 has a 25% chance of breaking down(these chances stack up.)

Found in:
Looted Supermarket
Burnt School
Old Bicycle Hire Shop
Town Library

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Goat/Donkey (suggested by HyperDemon)

2KM of use: Thirsty

6KM of use: Dehydrated

9-7KM of use: Death.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
(suggested by Griffon)
What about a random chance of a break-down? Maybe a system where the further you drive, the more of a chance you have of your vehicle malfunctioning?

For instance, you drive 10 KM and the following message is displayed, similar to how a message is displayed when you break a weapon:

As you drive along the barren wasteland, and you hear a loud pop and banging sound. Your car, if it is safe to call it that, has rolls to a halt, and cannot restart the duck-taped engine! Looks like you may be camping tonight...
On january 27, 2013
MadDonut

Let's all brainstorm and together, we shall create the ultimate car suggestion!

The desert, it's hot, it's barren. It's a scorching place of endless sand. Engines get hot and if the get too hot, they break down. So... Boom, the vehicle's radiator will need to be cooled with a Water Ration. Maybe even including a Water Cooler in the blueprint.

Now, what vehicles can traverse the dune? A gyrocopter is solid, but there is also lightweight vehicles, ATVs, construction tractors, tanks, pretty much most things with treads. I think two wheeled vehicles, even dirt bikes, wouldn't work too well since their weight is narrowed into two points rather than the four points of the car, meaning that they could potentially sink in the sand. I guess they're many answers to this, but a lightweight vehicle would be the best since they're the most common and easiest to drive and work with (some survivors may not know much about vehicles).

A vehicle should have some capabilities of storage. It should be able to carry multiple heavy items, but perhaps at the price that the vehicle is more likely to break down or get stuck depending on how many items and/or people with/without the items they carry themselves. A way of storage could be the trunk, which works well, but you'll need some extra space. So, remove the rear seats for extra room, which also lowers the allowed occupants to two, the driver and a passenger.

You're going to be driving into the zombie infested wasteland so you don't really want to go without the proper defenses. Most defensive items might weigh the car down too much. So, we're going to have to resort to lightweight protection like Wire Mesh and Plywood. Here's a video about zombie-proofing your car.

There's more stuff to add, but it's a start.
On january 27, 2013
Infinite_Smile
