On january 31, 2013
Walar

Iceman13 started a new story thread which gave me an idea.
In the game we have the Infirmary which can heal anybody in town for AP-s and it only needs some basic materials, 6 PP-s and a paracetoid; and the Architects Study where one bottle of vodka and one steroid is enough for the whole town to brainstorm new BP-s every night.
So why don't we have a Bar where everyone could take some shots and get drunk if wants on every other day (because of hangover) if it has been built? Of course it won't give the alcohol distinction, but it would boost your AP-s.
The needed resources would be: 5 planks, 3 iron, 3 patchwork beans and one from every type of alcohol (Wake The Dead, Vodka Marinostov, Winness).
Or it could be 2 planks less and a table needed instead to make it not so easy to build.


Edit: Sorry if it has been mentioned somewhere earlier.
On january 31, 2013
Colette

Well, a building that restores AP to people seems too overpowered, even if they can only use it every other day. But it could be more balanced by decreasing the success rate. For example, taking a drink could restore AP and make you drunk, but also could make you Exhausted (After guzzling your drink you start feeling sleepy. You're feeling Exhausted now) or terrorised (Finishing that drink made you feel worse than before. Sick of your drunken emotional ranting, your neighbors drag you to your home so you can cry alone).

You swallow your shot blindly and feel something scratching all the way down in your throat. You realize it was the floating finger from the Wake the Dead. What you are feeling now is above words.

I don't think it would be overpowered with all this side effects.

On february 4, 2013
MadDonut

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Bell Tower Rare Blueprint
Normally you'd have to wait for the frantic shrieks of your neighbor to act as the nightly call to arms, but now with this new global alarm system, your town will be up and ready for battle in no time! Unfortunately, the sound may attract the distant stragglers...

Upgrading increases personal defense.
Level 1:
+2 personal for every citizen.
+1% zombie spread in the World Beyond.
Level 2:
+5 personal for every citizen.
+5% zombie spread in the World Beyond.
Level 3:
+7 personal for every citizen.
+10% zombie spread in the World Beyond.
Level 4:
+10 personal for every citizen.
+2% and +5 for Watchmen.
+15% zombie spread in the World Beyond.
Level 5:
+13 personal for every citizen.
+3% and +6 for Watchmen.
+20% zombie spread in the World Beyond.

Requires: 5x Wrought Iron ; 6x Patchwork Beam ; 2x Belt ; Watchtower must be built.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

I'm currently trying to formulate a neat idea based off the soul shop suggested here. So far I'm thinking of a regular shop which would have measly items for a hefty soul price and a premium shop which would have quality items that you can buy with a combination of money and soul points. Not for too much money though, so some items might only require like three bucks and a thousand soul points to buy. Some items could be limited time so that it's not like you buy something and it just sits there. Heroes get discounts too. Leaderboard rankings would remain and a "Most Soul Points ever earned:" box would appear on your page to keep track of your record.

Sure if the ghoul ate your brother it's an easy choice, but do you really want to ignite those blasphemous Sherlock Holmes/Van Helsing's who attack every person in town until they get their kill?

However I do believe that you should get a distinction for being eaten by one. A rare death like LMS and Infection.

On february 7, 2013
TOShokking

Even promoting being eaten will simply promote abuse.
One person will get Ghoul, and they'll get loads of Hero days for eating everyone, everyone else will try and keep the town going so they can be eaten for the distinction.

~EDIT~ Putting a cap on the Hero days you can get from Ghoul may limit it, but I doubt it'd stop it that much. A free Hero day is free - people will do all sorts for free stuff.
On february 8, 2013
MadDonut

Ladies and gentlemen, gather around, gather around!

Do you tire of the same in and out routines of zombie slaying?
Do you feel pathetic when you flail about your uninteresting utensils of poor destruction?
Do you want some more D-I-Y in your Die?

Well, you're in luck!
A new line of modified weaponry has spawned out of the brilliant mind of the marvelous inventor and self proclaimed prophet, MadDonut!

Ladies and gentlemen, hang on to your seats as I unveal...

THE ASTOUNDING ARMOURY

What has happen is that two previous suggestions were clumsily collided into one to give a double deal of foundation for my following ideas!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Weapon Blueprint Misc. Item
Survivors have been always transferring the ideas of weapons since the start of the end of mankind. Scattered about by the wind are these old slips of paper with amazing contraptions that could save an entire town written and drawn on them. Sadly, this paper is useless until you can decipher the components at a Weapon Workshop... (Advanced Workshop renamed Weapon Workshop)
Found anywhere even before the Weapon Workshop is unlocked. Although, if you go to special ruins like the Army Outpost, Equipped Trench, or Old Police Station, the more likely you are to find blueprints for ranged weapons while places like the Abandoned Construction Site, Garden Shed, or PI-KEYA Furniture, are more likely they are to provide melee upgrades.
Must be in town and Weapon Workshop must be built to use the weapon blueprint.
"After examining this sketched drawing of some sort of fierce device obliterating a horde of green people with little angry faces, you've gotten a rough idea of how to realistically build your own (weapon)!"
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

These are the more premium items for the Weapon Workshop that can only be found via the Weapon Blueprints.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Battery Magazine Modification Misc. Item
With a few rearrangements and the addition of a slight nook bellow a Battery Launcher 1-ITF's barrel, you can slip in an extra round into the magazine at the cost of its power.
After unlocking its blueprint, it can be crafted with 1x Wrought Iron ; 1x Duct Tape ; 1x Copper Pipe.

WEAPON STATS
(When attached to a Battery Launcher 1-ITF, the name changes to Battery Launcher 2-ITF)
-20% than normal kill chance.
+0 ; +18

NOTES: Holds 2x Battery.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Dual Machete Weapon Item
When you place two machetes together end to end, what you get is a terrorizing weapon of twirling steel that works like helicopter blades as it slices through the horde.
After unlocking its blueprint, it can be crafted with 2x Machete ; 1x Duct Tape ; 1x Handful of Nuts and Bolts.

WEAPON STATS
Kills 3 zombies per attack.
100% kill rate.
25% breakage rate.
+0 ; +7

NOTES: When broken, it breaks into 1x [broken] Machete
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
The Meat Machine (uncharged) Heavy Weapon Item
Only the Crows know what sick mind invented this, but you got to admit it's pretty potent. By combining the grinding action of a Chainsaw and the dicing effects of a Lawnmower, this beast from hell will chew through just about anything until its tiny little motor engine puts out.
After unlocking its blueprint, it can be crafted with 1x Chainsaw (loaded/unloaded) ; 1x Lawnmower ; 2x Rusty Chain.

WEAPON STATS
Kills 5 zombies per attack.
100% to kill.
13% chance to break.
40% chance to deplete the Battery.

NOTES: Uses 1x Battery until it is depleted (see just above). The Meat Machine can be renamed: "The Flesh Grinder", "The Meat Mower", or "The Chain-Mower". It looks a Lawnmover, but the Chainsaw's body attached to the rear of the handlebars and the blades are covered in metallic chains and dried blood.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Now, ladies and gentlemen, after seeing this dazzling display of dangerous doomday weapons, I, the one and only MadDonut, elect on you to present whatever weapons or modifications you can think of! Even if you don't think it's very good, through the magic of my magnificent mind, I can turn your sours into sweets! Or maybe even the other way around!

On march 9, 2013
Colette

Suggestion!

Variation of the Ghoul: Vegetarian Ghoul .

The vegetarian ghoul knows that eating human flesh is bad for their health (and some of them argue that is morally incorrect, but that's another point). Vegetarian Ghouls need to eat vegetables to stay alive, or they starve to death pretty much like regular ghouls. Since Vegetarian Ghouls are kind of angry because there is no good salad in the World Beyond, they can focus their rage on people to kill them immediately (again, like regular ghouls, but without eating them), granting them a hero day. Likewise, their protein-lacking bodies can't withstand too much damage, being killed with a single punch.

How about it?

If you want to play as a ghoul, you have to eat human meat. That is the price of it.
Live with the cannibalism distinctions or leave without never playing as a ghoul. The ability to kill and devour anyone is the essence of playing as a ghoul.
And don't call the cannibalism distinction stupid! That is one of the most metal distinctions in this game.

Eat vegetables if you want and imagine that you can insta-kill scarecrows or other useless vegetable-related stuff, but don't want to change the way the ghoul-system works, please!

It could work with vegetables - but the whole idea of the Ghoul is you're part zombie.

Since when have zombies roamed the streets, feasting on the bowels of every melon and apple they can find, chasing with relentless ferocity the very last grape of a bunch?

They're cold-blooded killers that strike fear into all but the most hardened survivor of the apocalypse, not vegans who enjoy the occasional fruit salad.
Nothing against vegans, but that's not the point.

On march 11, 2013
Walar

Colette: here is the solution to your problem if you want to play as a ghoul and don't want the cannibalism stuff.
You only need 2 things at the same time:
1 - Travelers corpse, because it has the most potential to turn you into those non-vegetarian carnivorous zed-human hybrid beasts.
2 - Cyanide! Swallow it before the day ends and you don't get those shiny red marks on your soul page. Do this even if you didn't succeeded to become a ghoul as TC-s give the distinction.
Side note: Going into the desert and spending the night there without hiding can replace the cyanide, but I'm afraid you don't like those distinctions neither.

With this method you can enjoy all the benefits as playing as a ghoul for near a day! Just don't forget to eat the pill after you killed/maimed/raped your fellow town-mates

On march 11, 2013
Walar

Just playing with the idea to make Colette's bad joke even worse:

As a veghoul (vegetable ghoul, as an opposition to the real ghouls) you are a human partially infected with floral DNA.

You can become one from eating: Suspicious looking vegetable, Intestine melon, Apple, Gardener's Corpse (it can be found searching in undepleted zones, but you have higher chance finding one in a Garden Shed).

You have to met the following conditions to survive:
- You are addicted to water. If you didn't finish your day with the refreshed status you die. Plants need many water, especially in a desert.
- You have to stay at least 16 hours daily in the desert to collect sunshine for photosynthesis. If not, you loose from your nutrient meter. If the Fertilizer is built, you loose less of it. If you drop below half, you 'starve' to death. You can consume a living citizen whole to fully refill it.
- You can not eat any normal food.
- You die instantly if someone slaps you in the face with a Ness-Quick Weedkiller.
- You are immune to the effects of any infection and addiction.
- Moving in the world beyond costs you +1 AP for every km. Plants live a stationary lifestyle.

WalarJust playing with the idea to make Colette's bad wonderful joke even worse better[...] Plants need many water, especially in a desert.

Plants do not necessarily need much water. Particularly those in a desert. Plants like cactus have water-preservation techniques that allows them to store water and use it much more efficiently. In fact, too much water is harmful for them .

Either way, we need Veghouls. For a healthier way of life

On march 12, 2013
MadDonut
ColetteEither way, we need Veghouls. For a healthier way of life

It wouldn't be healthier, it'd be a horribly unbalanced diet.

Meat is a necessary for healthy living since you need the protein. Eating only grains and goods would be detrimental to your health. At least when you eat someone else, you absorb their nutrients which is why for a truly healthy meal, you should fatten up your townmates with healthy food and eat them. Source: School's cafeteria food pyramids ; MadDonut's Healthy Kitchen Cookbook

On may 12, 2013
MadDonut

The Wasteland Trader

The Wasteland Trader, in simple terms, is a buy-with-real-money shop RP'd into the game disguised as a dune traveling merchant wagon. The shop sells mainly one use or limited use items. They are split into two sections: Basic Items and Premium Items. The idea of The Wasteland Trader is to allow citizens to get a specific and cheaper boost to their game. It also encourages them to buy Hero days and gets MT extra money. If you have ideas about items for The Wasteland Trader to sell, use this skeleton:

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
################################################
Wasteland Traveler Ideas

Item (Basic/Premium)
interesting description
Stats
Possible Cost (MT will most likely decide this themselves so it's best to just use Low/Med/High)
Abilities
################################################
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
################################################
The Wasteland Trader

Basic Items are usable by any citizen, are usually cheaper than Premium Items, and are usually less powerful.
The cabinet that houses these items is old and wooden with three Twisted Planks used as the individual shelves. Cobwebs cuddle in the corners and crevices of the shoddy wood work. A dead cockroach lays on the rightest area of the top shelf. There is little to no decoration at all. To the right and left are two partly visible doors of the cabinet. Clicking on one side causes the doors to shut and reopen, displaying the next 'page' of items. Clicking the opposite side causes the doors to again shut and open, but this time displaying the items you've seen before. Items, when hovered over, shows its price and description and is outlined with a soft white. When an item is clicked, the shopper will be shown the item's abilities and such in full as well as a large BUY ITEM button. Pressing the BUY ITEM button will cause a Are You Sure? window to appear. Click YES and that item will be given to you.


Premium Items are usable by only Heroes, are quite costly, and can be very potent.

This cabinet has been more taken care of. A purple velvet fabric lays underneath the items. There is one small cobweb on the bottom shelf in a naturally darkish corner, obviously missed by whoever had been tending the cabinet. The woodwork still have creaks and cracks, but it has been stained and is very well polished. The 'page turning' effect is still here and works pretty much exactly the same, just with better looking cabinet doors. The Items, when hovered over, show the price and description of the item, but these items glow with a more prominent golden outline. The windows, as described above, make a return and so forth.
################################################
I'd make some items right now, but I just got Skyrim and it awaits, so ciao!

P.S. Crows, can you sticky this thread again, replacing the Avatar for the Crow thread?
On may 12, 2013
SaucyemmettC

Don't make this any more "pay to win"
On may 12, 2013
MadDonut

Yeah.. I admit it kinda reeks of Play to Win, but the trick would be to make the items not overpowered with very limited usage and quite costly so at most people will be buying one item every once in awhile in emergency. Forgot to mention it, but you can only buy one specific item per Season, depending of course if all suggested and implemented items would work with that kind of system.
On may 12, 2013
MadDonut

I just realized that I don't know how to convert dollars to euros, but eh. They'll decide the final price themselves.

################################################
Wasteland Traveler Ideas

Metal Detecting Shovel Basic
A large battery connected to an electromagnet attached the tip of the shovel causes the shovel head to pull towards items in the sands. It's pretty useful for finding things, but sadly the contraption tends to break after use.
Gives the user a normal Seeker ability that does NOT stack with a Hero's Seeker abilities. It doesn't, however, count as a hero power, but can only be bought once per Season.
Cost: Low. $7-$14. $9 perhaps?
Destroyed after use.
"The battery sizzles and the wires spark violently. You quickly drop the Metal Detecting Shovel as it turns itself into a pile of freshly fried rubbish."

Day of Might Basic
This peculiar-looking neon green elixir is very suspicious, but the merchant said that it gives you incredible strength, much more than anything else you may have tried. You are reluctant, but perhaps you should trust the smelly man that lives in a cramped caravan.
Allows you for the rest of the day to carry TWO heavy items.
Cost: Medium. $15-$20. $15 perhaps?
Consumed on use.
################################################

Feel free to give feedback, of course.
On may 12, 2013
Workshop$83126
Animated Corpse

I strongly dislike the idea that one can instantly become even more powerful by spending more money.
More Hero rewards for having been a hero for a very long time would be heaps better in my opinion. There, it would be rewarding long standing supporters of the game.

This suggestion that you can get items by buying them goes against the spirit of the game, I reckon. I don't like its implications or the general gist of it.

On may 13, 2013
SaucyemmettC

Well about heroes in meta's joining randoms as a resident between jumps...

I am quite thankful that motion twin conned heroes with this trap. My reasons are simple. Because you pompous meta twats will muddy up random towns even worse then they are now! Hehehe. In my travels I have met a-many meta players who jump into a town for a day or two and then day three they say "sorry, have a jump", and binge on drugs and boosters or build launchers, or run outside and gather up as many distinctions as their withered corpses can carry and then die with a satisfied smile on their faces. Maybe a-many is unfair of me to say. Only a few I guess. But I have met many meta players who join a town for a day or two and then walk outside to meet their metas. I find this incredibly selfish, and quite hurtful. Just because we aren't aiming for the top of ranked doesn't mean you can trample a town beneath your oversized feet as you trudge back and forth waiting for your buddies to pick you up and take you to the party! Heh. And I know quite well that the amount of these selfish pricks jumping into random towns and stealing slots from people who would of been a lot more productive to the town would double or triple if it didn't mean wasting paid for hero days!

Just because it's not "important" to you doesn't mean it ain't fer others.

Coldflame

My idea on how to flesh that out:
Add another type of town: League Towns. These would have their own leaderboards. Anyone who places on the 'bronze' league's leaderboards will be in the next league up next season, and can only play in 'silver' league towns. They then progress onto the 'gold' league, and then the 'platinum' league. At then the 'crow' league. No water in the well. No buildings. 10x10 map only. Infections guaranteed kill. The winners would get some kind of extra-special reward.

On june 9, 2013
Too_Ton

I made a "for fun" unlock system which may/may not be taken seriously. These bonuses would apply to heroes and residents, except for the fact that some of the abilities stated are overshadowed by heroes.

30 day unlock: Helping hand
Description: Allows a resident to escort ONE person. (Small advantage, overshadowed by heroes)

100 day unlock unlock: Team player
Description: When in a zone with another resident (or player) the zone gains one additional CP. Does NOT stack. Ex: 4 residents only gives 1 extra CP not 2.

175 day unlock: Seasoned adventurer
Description: Allows a resident or hero to have a 10% chance to escape a zone unharmed. If failed, player must wait for someone to come or accept a 100% chance of fleeing the zone with injury.

250 day unlock: Air reserve
Description: 10 more seconds in a ruin than present time. (Minor advantage)

325 day unlock: Adept Movement
Description: 5% chance of not using an ap while moving in the World Beyond.

365 day unlock: Lucky finder
Description: Allows a resident/hero have 5% more chance to find an item from an undepleted zone.

I feel that these unlocks are not that overpowered considering all of the stated abilities will barely affect the game. Residents honestly have no way of escaping an infested zone, no way of saving even a single person with escort mode on, and in general feel like fodder. (Not meant to offend anyone here.) Are residents supposed to feel that much inferior due to not paying for hero days?
On june 9, 2013
Infinite_Smile

oh, sounds fantastic, but are those "bonuses" activated constantly or you have to get them somehow?

Too_Ton

Smash zombie skulls with this rusty, three-foot long mass of steel.
80% to kill a zombie.
35% chance to break.
+2 | 0

skyguy

I shall recommend the (exploding) Vibrator. Hate your local terrorized citizens? No fear! Use the (exploding) vibrator to finish them with a bang! It gives a special distinction for the unlucky receiver of the (exploding) vibrator. The (exploding) Vibrator is a combination item of a vibrator+Semtex+detonator.

The (exploding) Vibrator appears exactly like a normal vibrator, but when used gives a 90% chance to kill the user. When killed by it you receive the distinction "Buttrocket", and the first title for it is "Butt Banger" which requires one "Butt Rocket" distinction.

The death appears the next day on the daily gazette, and notification in the town register after the attack. The messages for everything will be posted later, any recommendations to edit it will be great.


Thanks,

Skyguy the hippie cannibal

On june 28, 2013
MadDonut

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Urine Filtration Unit (incomplete) Heavy Rare Misc. Item
Drink your own piss! As well as everyone else's because the ineffective filter requires several samples (approximately 5 separate pisses) to fill one jerrycan. Unfortunately, this unit is in need of repairs...
Combine with 1x Copper Pipe, 1x Wire Mesh, 1x Water Cooler Bottle (empty) to create Urine Filtration Unit (complete).
Found in Safe.
Found at normal scavenging zones, Citizen's Tent, Nuclear Bunker.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Urine Filtration Unit (empty) Heavy Rare Misc. Item
Drink your own piss! As well as everyone else's because the ineffective filter requires several samples (approximately 5 separate pisses) to fill one jerrycan.
Each person can only piss in one Urine Filtration Units per day.
Can only be used when inside the town.
User must not be Thirsty of Dehydrated.
Each use increases the Urine Filtration Unit's amount by 1.

"You take a tinkle into the Urine Filtration System...
______________________________________________

The Urine Filtration System is now 20% full."

1/5 = 20% ; 2/5 = 40% ; 3/5 = 60% ; 4/5 = 80% ; 5/5 = 100%
Once full, you can [Use: Urine Filtration System], and then a Jerrycan will appear along with an empty version of the Urine Filtration System in your inventory, removing the filled version.
Can only be used when inside the town.
Each time you [Use: Urine Filtration Unit], you get a "Making Magic" distinction.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

On july 15, 2013
BlackVoid

Two new building suggestions. It saddens me that Die2Nite is unwinnable, so I came up with a way that may be considered at least prolonging farther than even the farthest town can go. I present,
The Ark:(Extremely rare BP) Requires, 50 patchwork beams, 25 twisted planks, one quality log and 50 AP.
Ark TextThis hunk of driftwood sure would come in handy if there were ever a flood. Comes prepackaged with a second town onboard.
The Flood:(Comes prepackaged with The Ark BP) Prerequisite: The Ark. Requires, 100 rations, one rusty chain, one jarpen table, one blood sacrifice and 100 AP.
Flood TextAre you sure you want to do this? You'll be killing the poor sap, just so YOU can live longer. Fine, it's on your conscience not mine. A blood sacrifice is a single person to be killed in order to summon the flood. When the Ark is completed it opens up a tab, like the workshop and watchtower which allows you to vote on who should be sacrificed. At the instant The Flood is completed, everyone still alive in town is transported to a new, randomized map on day 0, with the same name. Nobody except the people alive from the previous town is in this one.

ColetteYou could also add that if you drink a bottle of alcohol you die of alcohol poisoning. Taking a drug would make you hooked 100% of the time, and 99% of the time would make you die of an overdose. You would only be able to check the forums once a day, and every stinking pig you find would attack you, leaving you Injured. Every time you put AP on a construction a wooden plank or a beam would fall over your head, with 99% chances of killing you. Camping would have a default chance of -99% of survival. And every citizen scavenging outside would have a 67% chance of having a meteorite falling over them for every item they find.

Come on, people. The desert's already as dangerous as it needs to be.

On july 23, 2013
Kollin

This is not as much an "idea" for the future of the game, as it is a possibly really cool feature. Like, I know it won't even be considered, but it is COOL!

Ok, so, alongside the boarders of the map (Most likely in a hardcore town with bigger maps), hidden in a random instance, would be a tunnel.
Now, to make it harder to get to this tunnel, larger horde spawns could form around this area, more than in other parts, so it could not be as easy to get to. Maybe even, only a rare select few towns would come with such a structure.

But say, a lone survivor of a town, perhaps... A LMS, if you will. But say he began wandering out into the wastes, knowing his death was near... And as he neared the edge of the map, an odd structure was visible. Using the remaining supplies left, the zeds of the area were eliminated to finally get to the instance.

Upon further inspection, the "structure" was actually an opening to a tunnel system. Either an old sewer system, or metro tunnel... The survivor enters it, and while anticipating death that day... The survivor was reborn.

Traveling through the tunnel, a light could be seen, and as the survivor approaches it... A noise can be heard. Wait No, a Song

TUNNEL SNAKES RULE!
WE'RE THE TUNNEL SNAKES,
THAT'S US...
AND WE RULE, RULE, RU-RU-RU-Rarara!
http://www.tunnelsnakes.com/


Haha, just a little reference there... I was serious up to the point of the song, but lets get back on track, shall we?

The Survivor sees a light at the end of the dark and musty tunnel, and as he steps out into the sunlight, far off in the distance, what looks like a settlement can be seen. The first time in Die2Nite history, a resident has trekked his way to a new town...

In town log:
From the Town's Walls, oddly enough, a fellow survivor is spotted... A new survivor... Not one from this area.

So as you can see, in short, it would be like a random spawning tunnel in a hardcore town that if traveled through, would lead to a new town. I do not mean this for an actual like entry... Just thought of this since the day I started playing!!

Thanks if you actually read it! And sorry if this is considered off topic
On july 23, 2013
BlackVoid

I think it's a cool idea, but the hordes would have to be massive, because Metas would find a way to get 20+ people through.
On july 23, 2013
Kollin

Yea, I agree, the only thing I could never think of would be a way to nerf it to the point it was barely ever actually encountered. I just thought a possible way to almost "escape" your town would be cool, in the most dire situations.

On september 12, 2013
MadDonut

Suggestions inspired by my pal, MrCreeper.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Stopsign Sign Miscellaneous item
Stop!
Not of much use currently due to the lack of motor-vehicles, but it's metallic edge gives you an idea..
Combine with 1x Copper Pipe, 1x Sheet Metal, and 1x Duct Tape to create a Stop-Sign Battleaxe.
Found in normal scavenging zones, Blocked Road, Wrecked Cars, and Wrecked Transporter.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Stop-Sign Battleaxe Heavy Weapon item
Stop the hordes in their tracks with this highly imposing (though rough) weapon.
65% chance to break.
90% chance to kill a zombie.
6% chance to kill 2 zombies.
+20 | + 0
Made by combining 1x Copper Pipe, 1x Sheet Metal, 1x Duct Tape, and 1x Stopsign Sign.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Jar of Werewolf Blood Rare Food item
It is said by drinking the blood of a dog, you can gain beastly powers under the moon's light. Of course, not many people are sure if this actually works, but it can't hurt to try. Can it?
55% to fail.
30% chance to infect you.
45% chance to work and gives you Enraged!! status.
Found in normal scavenging zones and Cosmetics Lab.
60% chance to come from taking a Guard Dog to the Butcher.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Enraged!! Health status
GRAAAH!!! You're so angry you could just punch someone! You told them they wouldn't like it when you're angry!
-2 required to Attack someone.
+10 | +0
Now counts as +1 in the World Beyond (dangerous to be around) but without lowering your own CP.
Wake up Exhausted tomorrow because you were too angry to sleep.
-10% success when Searching.
Causes: Drinking Jar of Werewolf Blood, ?*
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
*what other causes can you guys think of? (besides things like having inactives in your town )

On october 2, 2013
Alfalfawar

Begging

The shunned should be given the option to beg for a specific item in the bank, or beg for anything in particular. Can only beg once per day. If an unshunned citizen fulfills the Beg by donating the requested item, they will then get a feel-good warm fuzzy feeling inside their chest, livening them up and giving them an extra AP booster "is anyone going to close the gates??".




Anti-Hero

This can be as an alternative for players without Hero Days. If chosen with Hero Days the player will display as a normal regular Resident so that know one knows whodunnit until it's already too late.

Pickpocket: citizens will have rumors spread about them that their pockets are bulging. Anti-Hero cannot see what items a citizen is carrying and the item will be random (if they are carrying more than one item).

Lockpick: Bypass Lock and Padlock and Chain. Costs AP and will remain unprotected until the owner locks them up again.

Take your time: When they break and enter they can take as many items as they can carry but cannot revisit unless the Town is in utter chaos.

Turn out your pockets!: Has option to turn out their pockets for everyone to see (dispute resolution alibi).

All actions can only be performed once per day unless Chaos Mode is in effect.

New distinctions for the following actions: Pickpocket, Lockpick, Turn out your pockets!.

You should get a Hero Day for every 10 straight days you can survive in a single Town as a villainous Anti-Hero. Anti-Hero can only win Last Man Standing if there are no other competitors, they must be the sole survivor left in Town (or just close the gates on everybody else).

goob

For what? Never leaving town? That's absurd. There are already a lot of passive players in the game. Nothing wrong with not wanting to risk getting stuck somewhere (we all have different play styles), but really we don't need more incentives for people to stay inside every single day.

Staying inside because the town needs people to convert/build is one thing. Never leaving town just to get a distinction is something entirely different. We already have distinctions for points spent on construction, don't we? That should be sufficient.

Seven posts ago I mention Anti-Hero. It could give a bonus for Insurrections, taking only 10 days, meaning it would be much more difficult to survive for 10 days for the Hero Day. Hero vs. Anti-Hero
Anti-Hero should get to choose their Town and if they go to a non-distant Town (small map) that has atleast one Hero, they can compete for saving/sabotaging the Town. Anti-Hero gets a distinction if the Town is destroyed within 5 days. Hero already has the Spiritual Guide distinction.

On october 10, 2013
Alfalfawar

Suggestion: Zombie Players

Get 6AP to start with, can sacrifice 6AP to grow by one zombie or use them to travel. If a human dies overnite in the same zone they will leave a brain which can be consumed for a bonus 6AP.

* Start with a single zombie in a random location.
* Each night the zombie count will grow if unattacked by humans.
Grows by 2 if hasn't moved all day, otherwise grows by 1.* The more zombies a player controls, the more AP it costs to move.
* They can sense human players, by smell, one zone away.
* They can trace a fresh human trail (trail dies overnite).
Trails can be traced either back to Town or to the player.* Get points for trapping a human and devouring them at nite.
* If they land at the Town they die if there are citizen's inside the Gates.
* Can take part in The Attack, risk death or win a Hero Day.Town must be destroyed on that Attack for success.* Zombie Players cannot see Town/Player infos (cheat prevention).
* Can hide in explorable ruins.

There could be a maximum number permitted depending on the size of the map.

On october 19, 2013
Walar

Alfalfawar, your suggestions make no sense. Why should the inactives kept alive?
If you force drink/feed/whatever them, you just waste boosters as they will be alive but still no use of the town.
This is Die2Nite, a game about dying. Not Sims, where you have to keep everyone alive and the same town goes on forever.

You are flooding the last 3 pages with your suggestions, which are never will be integrated in the game for the following reasons:
1) They need too much coding (Zombie Players, Anti-Hero)
2) They would make the game too easy (Crows Bar, Attack AP, Gatekeeper)
3) They are against the freedom of the game (Ministry of Slavery, OP Hero skills)
4) They add nothing to the game, but would make more bad players (Anti-Hero, staying in town distinctions)

My suggestion: learn to play the game as it is now before you want to change (and ruin) it.

The Town Welcome Sign was the only idea which makes sense (and I liked it), but you can see that number on the bottom of the Citizens page.

Alfalfawar

Rehabilitation Program (Construction Blueprint)
Use an AP for a 10% chance of losing Hooked! status.

Candlestick/Lantern (Item)
If placed in our home, prevents us from becoming Terrorized when our Home is being assaulted after a breach and we surviver.

Aladdin's Magic Lamp (Object)
Rare item found in dessert grants three wishes to Town, cannot wish for the same thing more than once each Town. Each Lamp can only give three wishes but each citizen can only make one wish per Town. Wishes are recorded in logs but Hero with Manipulator skill can hide what they wished for.Change Profession
Hero Day
Heroic Return from any distances
Miraculously discover any item (except another Lamp ofc)
Cheat Death
Rescue citizen
Terrorize citizen
Shun citizen
Murder citizen
Purify citizen (return clean status if lost due to drugs and removal of all negative status)
Bring citizen back to life again, raised from dead (fresh corpse must be within the Walls)
Restore 8 AP to citizen
Secure LMS guaranteed to choose citizen over other competitors
Complete Construction (must possess blueprint)
Clear the zombies out from any zone of choice
Rain Dance to brew up a storm for the Well
Replenish all depleted zones
Strength, become stronger for an additional control points
Sight, keen eyes for shorter scavenging time
Survival Instincts for safer campsite
Insomnia for improved Watch
Additional Professional Tool for multple professions simultaneously
Additional Chest/Rucksack capacities

Alfalfawar

Religions

Like if we choose of the ancient Egyptian will let us affect our afterlife. Scientology will probably be one of the more popular choices (maybe we can finally get to play that AlphaSIN/Galaxy55?? But the KUBE is still the best!!). Haitian will let us play as a zombie although we will be undercontrolled by from the Shamans if there are any still alive survivers. Bwiti is from the quote bellow, proper actually a zombie religion.



bark of the bitter iboga plant (thing)

The Shamans can do something with this to communicate with the dead. Make a tea or something, whatever it says I cannot understand it.
http://zombieresearchsociety.com/arch...WEST AFRICAN ZOMBIE RELIGION
The Babongo Tribe of West Africa believe they possess the ability to communicate with zombies. In fact their entire religion, called Bwiti, is based on cultivating a strong relationship with the zombies they claim are all around.

To see zombies the tribe chews on the bark of the bitter iboga plant while drinking a ritual tea. Once the ceremony is complete the undead show themselves to the Babongo, but it‚Äôs important to note that these are not considered ghosts or spirits. They are believed to be actual physical creatures, as Anthropologist Mark Leitchman explains:‚ÄúThe Bwiti zombies are as real and solid as any animal or plant one might find in the forest. They don‚Äôt appear and disappear, or fly through the night sky, or even live on another mystic plain. Humans simply have bad vision and the iboga plant acts as a pair of glasses showing us what‚Äôs always been there.‚ÄùWesterners who have participated in the Babongo ritual report suddenly finding their rooms filled with living human corpses. Some of the zombies simple stared and said nothing, while others offered advice and counsel.

Clearly the zombies found in Babongo culture behave differently than our understanding of how a modern zombie would. There is no flesh-eating or apocalyptic destruction. But the Bwiti like many primitive tribe across the globe have held their undead beliefs and traditions for centuries, proving that the notion of ‚Äúzombie‚Äù is not new in the slightest.I did read through some of the comments for it though, there are only 5 when I was did.

On november 19, 2013
lordwok

ok so how about this for an idea:

Dual(or maybe it should be duel) towns on the same large map.

heres how it would work...
both towns have regular amount of citizens and attacking zombies. towns are offcenter somewhat and in opposite corners.

citizens from one town cannot enter the "enemy" town until it is devastated, ghouls can of course sneak into the enemy camp.

each town has a color/flag and this is displayed next to citizens names so you can identify enemy players out in the world beyond at a glance.

what do you guys think? the competition for resources... the punching....looting your enemys bank when they go under!

THERE CAN ONLY BE ONE.
On november 19, 2013

Dual(or maybe it should be duel) towns on the same large map.

heres how it would work...
both towns have regular amount of citizens and attacking zombies. towns are offcenter somewhat and in opposite corners.

Suggestion: Martial Artist Class

So basically a new hero class. Class item will be his Dojo Headband.
It smells of sweat and blood. The proud symbol of your Dojo brands this headband, with this your unwavering courage is known to all. Let's just hope you can wax on and wax off the zombies...
Bonuses

Chance of killing a zombie with bare hands is now 60%, and can be used even if zone is in control (does not count towards fights of despair distinction however).

Can carry 2 heavy objects at once.

Has 4 control points in the world beyond but only when alone, more citizens in a zone will ruin his concentration.

Has a 50 defense bonus to watch but only when holding no items.

On november 29, 2013
Blaire

As a measure of respect to someone who has evidently thought about this, I will go through and systematically rip the logic behind that to shreds . Where applicable, of course. Condoms for water: we have water bottles for that. Ropes: much better stores, like Home Depot. Disinfectants: Pharmacies. Inflatable dolls: inferior to common inflatable raft. Batteries: omnipresent, check the dollar store. Glues: Home Depot. Medical Supplies: Pharmacies. Hoses: Home Depot. Pumps: (Don't know what you mean) Protective clothing: eh, maybe. Probably hilariously impractical though. Dextrose: What the hell is sugar doing here? Do I want to know? Chains: Home Depot. Nets: Nah, wouldn't really work, Sporting goods store would superior anyway. Nylons: Don't know what you're filtering, but go ahead and improvise away. Wax: Home Depot. Hammocks: They sell those? Sure, I guess. Flashlights: Dollar store/home depot. Paper: Home Depot* Alcohol/energy drinks/soft drinks: sure, though there are better places. Candy Bars: see previous. Sterile Metal and Glass equipment: Too generic to refute or discuss. Liquid Latex: Home Depot. Hooks and Locks: Not sure why'd you really need these in a zombie apocalypse, but whatever... Home Depot. Viagra: Did the research, I now know that Viagra helps treat jet lag recovery in hamsters. Segufix: Limited uses, but sure, why not.

Conclusion: Yeah, there's some stuff you can get there, but if I was going for almost any of it specifically, I'd go elsewhere. If I was engaging in random looting/ kleptomania, I'd almost always have better choices. That being said I admit that it would probably be a low-concentration area for zombies, and might allow you to pick up some things with little to no risk. That being said, I would still not fucking scavenge it.

Coda: Blaire arrives at Home Depot, only to see a huge traffic jam. Shit. Huge amount of people there work together and slaughter few nearby zombies. Yay!




*It should be noted that Blaire does not, in fact, work for Home Depot. Or own it.



JcMoney, congratulations on having one of the few suggestions I've seen that might actually work.

uh... I think this thread needs some:

New Ruin: Forgotten Church
This once holy place is now in ruins. Theres no way to know what it worshiped. Scavengers avoid such places as they are crowded with zombies (aparently the early-apocalypse people thought they could avoid the infection by coming here and pray ... funny story).

Drops:

Trestle
Old Door
Chuck Figurine
Winess
Human Flesh
Meaty bone

Bad place to camp. Spawns far away from town but close to Motel 666 Dusk and Sex Shops in a cluster way.

My suggestion is a slightly modified version of Alfafa's.

If you don't, when you try to move from the zone, you'll get stuck with a message showing up saying, You didn't bother to look around, did you? You tripped over something while minding your own business, and you fell into a deep hole. Let's hope someone can arrive to help you out...

And the ghoul can check on the trap and eat them!
On april 1, 2014
goob

As I sit here 40 minutes from home waiting for my broken down car to be repaired, I thought, "this would be a really bad time for a zombie apocalypse." Not that any time would be a good time, but this would be a particularly bad time. So that got me wondering.... can we have cars in d2n? We could build them from the car door, engine, and iron/metal. We don't need no stinkin tires or steering wheel. The car could be used for better camping chances or to escape a zed controlled zone with the chance of failure since you can't get too far not being able to steer. And the technician could make keys for the car!

I know, it won't happen, but I can dream.

I survived nicely with 2 camping days but now that I'm dead I can't even get into a distant region while in hero mode. I hope one of the devs see this because it would improve the game a bit more
On september 8, 2015
Dream
Inspiration for the people
MasterMinionI think they should lower the amount of soul points to get into a distant region. I just started playing and have played with a meta before where we did go to a distant region. I survived nicely with 2 camping days but now that I'm dead I can't even get into a distant region while in hero mode. I hope one of the devs see this because it would improve the game a bit more

the reason behind the 100 SP needed to join distant maps is that you learn enough about the game during collecting those 100 SP in small maps that distant maps wont be such a challenge because playing in distant maps while still clueless about the basics of the game may cause the newbie to make many common mistakes and get shunned, hanged and with it possible disliking the game may lead to quitting before even starting.


the other reason is anti-abuse so no one would think about making multi accounts and cheat joining distant maps even after deleting their accounts by the devs...

trust me, its OK the way it is

of course for residents who don¬¥t wish to buy hero days its probably the Dream to get the free hero days along with the distinctions, but the real fun in die2nite is not really winning hero days if you cant enjoy them in decent organized towns.

in time all realize that, except those who enjoy selfish play of course, for them selfish play is fun and LMS hunts fits perfectly with that...
